Lets meet around 1:25 and then get seats at 1:30...Movie starts at 1:55.

Dinner afterwards at 4:30 Ichiban Steakhouse and Sushi Bar.  

Please RSVP for dinner!!  I have reservations and several ladies didn't respond if they are going to dinner.

The film is based on the David vs. Goliath journey of Dr. Bennet Omalu, the forensic neuropathologist who made the first discovery of football-related brain trauma in a pro player and fought to bring awareness to the public. In his search for the truth behind the devastating malady, Omalu’s quest humanizes the price paid by professional athletes in impact sports but also by people who challenge the status quo as it exposes the political, cultural and corporate interests that fuel the business of sports. Alec Baldwin, Luke Wilson, Gugu Mbatha-Raw, Arliss Howard, Paul Reiser, David Morse and Albert Brooks

results.description:
This is one of our weekly sessions. Class begins at 7:00 with instruction on basic footwork and formations, allowing everyone to participate in some fun social dances. From about 8:00 until 10:15, we have a Social Class - the focus is on more experienced dancers and complex dances, but beginners are encouraged to stay and watch, and participate in some of the simpler dances. At some point in the evening, we will break for a spot of tea and other refreshments.

Beginners are always welcome, no partner necessary. (In fact, you will be encouraged to dance with more experienced dancers rather than with other beginners.)

The $7.00 fee per person for each class covers the cost of renting the room and paying the teacher. However, we do not want price to be an obstacle for anyone attending class. Beginners have the option of purchasing a coupon booklet (good for 10 classes) for $30. Full-time students can always pay only $3 to attend. If these options don't work for you, please let me or one of the teachers know and other arrangements can be made.

Please don't be discouraged by the lack of RSVPs - many of our members do not belong to Meetup and so do not RSVP here. There will definitely be a crowd of dancers present!

Of course, the real prize is meeting a Potential Match!  Again, this fun Ice-Breaker is Totally Optional with the MIXING & MATCHING taking place from 8:00 p.m. to 10:00 p.m. during the regular DANCE WHICH WILL CONTINUE UNINTERRUPTED FROM 8:00 P.M. TO MIDNIGHT FOR OUR ENTIRE CROWD WITH MUSIC BY DJ Ron! Admission $8 with complimentary Snacks available to be enjoyed by our guests!  Check-In time for "A PERFECT PAIR" is from 7:30 p.m. to 8:00 p.m..  MIXING & MATCHING will take place during the dance from 8:00 p.m. to 10:00 p.m. with the RAFFLE PRIZE DRAWING for participants later in the evening!!!  Participation in this cool Ice-Breaker is totally optional and our Main Event, THE SATURDAY SINGLES DANCE, where singles gather to socialize, dance, and meet new people, will be held from 8:00 p.m. to Midnight as always!  RSVP TODAY to be a part of this novel, fun, ice-breaking event and to win exciting Giftcards and Prizes! FOR MORE INFORMATION ABOUT THIS EVENT AND OUR DANCES: Call the Dance Line at[masked], email [masked], or visit the Dance Website at www.dancetonight.weebly.com

Its that time of year ... shorter days ... schools in full swing ... and well, we all want to keep skating!

For those who haven't skated the off season with us before, these are slightly less organized, unpatrolled skated.    What that means is distance and terrain varies.   Most likely there will be a hill or two ... maybe three.    And distance is usually 15-20 miles over about two to two and half hours.    We'll still be looking out for the last skater and regrouping periodically, and including an optional coffee stop mid to end of the skating.       We'll continue, weather permitting (roads dry) straight through 'til spring!

results.description:
This is a photo opportunity, not a formal meetup.

Ring in the holidays with displays that are bigger and better than ever.  

THIS RUNS FROM TODAY, NOV 27th,  UNTIL JANUARY 10th.   For some reason, I can't clear the date.  Because we can't clear the beginning date, we set it into January so everyone has a chance to see the announcement before the event ends.  

The nighttime Light Garden looks beautiful. If you visit, please share some of your photos. The most magical time of the year arrives with the opening of Winter Flower Show and Light Garden on Fri., Nov. 27. Bringing the familiar carol “Deck the Halls” to life, each of the changing exhibit rooms will embody the spirit of the holiday tune, complete with artful arrangements of LED lights, decorated fir trees, whimsical props, and, of course, plenty of seasonal favorites such as colorful poinsettias, aromatic paperwhites, showy amaryllis and a jaw-dropping massive evergreen situated in the pond of the Victoria Room.

Adding to the festive atmosphere, in the Outdoor and Discovery Gardens, the Winter Light Garden will sparkle with luminous orbs, trees and fountains of light. Garden Railroad will be on view too, taking you on a magical trip through the plots of nine fairy tales and fables brought to life with interactive buttons for children to push, and miniature living plants, shrubs and trees.

Winter Flower Show and Winter Light Garden, run through Sun., Jan. 10. Daily hours for Winter Flower Show are 9:30 a.m. – 11 p.m. and 5 – 11 p.m. for Winter Light Garden. Phipps closes at 5 p.m. on Thurs., Dec. 24 and reopens at 9:30 a.m. on Sat., Dec. 26. Admission is $15 for adults, $14 for seniors and students, and $11 for children (ages 2 – 18). Members and kids under 2 enter free.
results.name: Winter Flower Show/Light Garden, NOW thru Jan 10,  Photo op

results.description:
http://www.mindpub.com/art532.htm

We discussed most of the topics in the link above at our December meeting. But please click on it again.

Then scroll down to the bottom and click on Holiday Coping

Then scroll to the 6th item and click on Tips for New Year Resolutions

Since this January meeting is the start of the new year of 2016, let's talk about this topic. The first tip is: If you don't intend to keep resolutions, then don't make them. And the second tip is: If the attraction of status quo is greater than that of a change, then don't make the resolution. However .....
There is further commentary, leaving the table open for anyone who has made resolutions and wants to share them.

I particularly like this suggestion: Make a 10% improvement in your attitude of gratitude and satisfaction.

Continue reading and see what ideas you can share with the group. Some of you read the book "10% Happier" by ABC correspondent Dan Harris and might want to reference his experiences. And for those who have the "Happy Women Live Better" book by Valorie Burton, you might want to re-read Chapter 5 on Gratitude; how the art of appreciation causes you to work out more, sleep better, and be less agitated.

Note: We seem to run out of time before we run out of conversation, so please think about a topic or two you would like to facilitate for our future meetings -- the second Sunday of each month at 10:30 at the Robinson Eat N Park. If you provide the details, I will be happy to post the meeting notice. Looking forward to a great turnout. Thanks. JoAnn
results.name: 1/10 - Discussion: A New Year Attitude of Gratitude

About Italiano-Espresso©:

Italiano-Espresso was created with the idea of having weekly conversation get-togethers for all Italophiles to meet, practice and/or learn something Italian or in Italian.

Each week, there is one suggested/scheduled activity that will engage all speakers (from beginners to advanced and natives) in a fun and welcoming atmophere.

Spontaneous conversation is also welcome.

For those looking for a more structured learning environment, come and join us on Tuesdays (beginners) or Thursdays (intermediate) for Italian class (6:45pm/Wilkins School Community Center).

Italiano-Espresso is mainly held in coffeshops (i.e. the name "Italiano Espresso) and the location is chosen by the attendees on a monthly bases.

So, com'on out if you'd like to see us bring ITALIANO-ESPRESSO in your neck of the woods.

BIG NEWS: we have a BLOG!


The blog of Italiano Espresso is now online!

Wanna know more about our meetings? Check here the funniest topics we mention every Sunday: http://mondoitaliano.tumblr.com/

results.description:
Please sign up if you're planning on playing and bring your favorite games!  Newbies are very welcome.  We have some great teachers to help you get started on your gaming adventure.  Let us know when you sign up what game(s) you'll be bringing.  On Sundays there is plenty of free parking on the side streets and even right on Murray.  Crazy Mocha serves great coffee, specialty drinks, snacks and pastries.  They do allow us to bring food in if we take our trash with us. We usually play all day, break for dinner around 6:00, then it's back to gaming until everybody poops out. 

Incidentally, many of our regular players no longer bother to sign up (but I really wish they would!), so if it looks like only  one or two people are coming, there could actually be quite a few more.  Remember, I will always cancel a game Meetup if we aren't gaming that day, so you won't be sitting there all by yourself waiting for a friend.    And please, remember to change your rsvp to no if you can't make it that day!

$1.00 will be charged to help cover the fee Meetup charges and to buy games for the group.  Join us and let the games begin!!!

results.description:
Pay it Forward 

At this event we are thrilled to take part in a community project to help those in need keep warm and dry 

We are joining forces with each other, local business and churches to help those in need by creating mats made of plastic grocery bags. At this tent you will meet the women involved in the creation of this project and learn how to construct mats to keep those in need warm and dry. Please bring all your grocery bags that are stuffed in your cupboards and a pair of scissors and help us to begin this project. 

A vegan meal will be served as well during this gathering.

The Red Tent: Moonlodge: A Sacred Gathering of Women is a gathering of women that occurs at or around the new moon when most girls and women are in most need of support, rest and reflection. This is a timeless tradition observed by ancient cultures. It serves as a regular forum for empowering girls and women of all ages. Every decade in our lives is special and we each have something to offer. We each have a piece to the puzzle of life. 

Traditionally girls would enter the tent as soon as their bodies began to cycle with the moon. In the tent they would learn about their fertility cycles and every other faucet of being a woman . A red Tent is a gift of mystical understanding of womanhood where secret knowledge will be shared and women will learn the value of their bodies as physical temples and how to set personal boundaries accordingly. A Red Tent provides an authentic foundation of support and an opportunity to connect with your inner self, other women and the greater cycles as we journey around the astrological mandala, working with the themes and lessons of each sign , as well as with Native American teachings and ceremony. Through these teachings and ceremony we will experience greater wholeness and balance in our lives. The Red Tent is a place where you can let your hair down and relax  knowing that whatever is shared is not gossiped about outside the gathering. It is a nurturing space to gather without fear of competition. A place to explore new ideas and reflect upon our personal journeys. Each month we will share our strengths, vulnerabilities and life lessons mirrored in each other, which creates deeper understanding and compassion for ourselves and others. In the tent there is freedom to share life's high's and low's
results.how_to_find_us: You will be greeted at the door.
results.name: The Red Tent Moonlodge: A Sacred Gathering of Women

results.description:
2 Rules for the meet up:

1) No solicitation of services *cool if someone comes to you but consultants/lawyers/coaches beware, any sales pitches and you'll have to find a new Monday ritual

2) Make sure to state whether what you are saying is an opinion or fact (both very much welcome) so to not confuse anyone about where the point of view comes from

Location change: Repair The World - 6022 Broad St. (Around the corner from Zeke's Coffee - grab your coffee from there and head over)

Share or listen to ideas but don't be fooled this is not startup therapy or feeding the ego this is about getting to work and removing the obstacles to make your idea a reality.

All entrepreneurs are welcome and it's not uncommon for us to have musicians, artists, chefs, writers, developers, renovators, or just about anyone else you can think of join the conversation.
results.name: Get your ideas or business UNSTUCK!

venue.name: Meet outside Alpha Lab Gear / Thrill Mill / Repair the World

results.description:
Entrepreneurs helping each other. Bring your ideas, questions and experiences. Providing face-to-face help and feedback for your business in bite-sized chunks.

This meetup is right after the Unstuck Entrepreneur Meetup http://www.meetup.com/unstuckmondaymeetup/ which is right there at Repair the World from 8-9AM. Think about coming to BOTH!


After meeting outside in the lobby of Repair the World / Alpha Lab Gear / Thrill Mill, we adjourn upstairs to Alpha Lab Gear.

This meetup is run by an experienced entrepreneur who started a business, ran it for over 20 years and successfully exited to a public company. He now keeps busy mentoring for a nationally recognized accelerator, reviewing business plans/pitches for investors and consulting for businesses & non-profits. When asked “why do a meetup?” he says he is looking to “pay it forward” by helping people make less mistakes than he made.
results.name: Entrepreneur Monday Morning Roundtable - Entrepreneurs Helping Each Other

results.description:
To facilitate meaningful conversations as a single group, this MeetUp is limited to 10 participants. The charge for the MeetUp will be left as a group tip to the server. We will display an 8.5" x 11.0" sign to help you find the activity. You can see a copy of the sign in the "General Pictures" Photo Album.

INTRODUCTIONS


We will have a round of introductions during each meeting. This will give you the opportunity to present yourself, your company, and your product or service to everyone else in the room. You should bring at least 15 business cards to hand out to the group as you make your introduction. Please be courteous and respectful of everyone's interest level and time -- KEEP YOUR INTRODUCTION TO 60 SECONDS OR LESS! We don't have to vacate the room immediately after the activity; if anyone is interested in learning more about your product or service, they can have a longer conversation with you right after the activity.

GUEST SPEAKER


We will have a different guest speaker every month. You can find the guest speaker that will be joining us on any particular month by looking at "Guest Speakers" under the "Discussion" tab.

WALK IN POLICY


We want to encourage attendees to RSVP for the meetings, and discourage walk-ins without an RSVP. The RSVPs help us with the planning and coordination of the meetings. Walk-ins without an RSVP will be charged $20. This fee is in addition to and separate from the cost of the lunch. The reason for this charge is to be fair with the participants that took the time and effort to RSVP. Individuals that walk in without an RSVP may have to sit at a side table separate from the main table that is reserved for participants with an RSVP. As a reminder, we want to keep the meeting limited to a small group of participants so we can have a single meaningful conversation, instead of various fragmented and superficial conversations.
results.name: Networking Lunch

We meet in Room 220, which can be difficult to find if you've not been there before, so it is best to arrive early so the intrepid, experienced members who already know the way can lead you. Bringing breadcrumbs is optional, but be aware that they clean and polish the floors in the evenings, and this is even more effective than birds for removing trails of breadcrumbs. This is one of our weekly sessions. Beginners' hour starts at 7:00 with instruction on basic footwork and formations, allowing everyone to participate in some fun social dances. From about 8:00 until 9:15, we have a Social Class - the focus is on more experienced dancers and complex dances, but beginners are encouraged to stay and watch, and participate in some of the simpler dances.


Beginners are always welcome, no partner necessary. (In fact, you will be encouraged to dance with more experienced dancers rather than with other beginners.)

The $7.00 fee per person for each class covers the cost of renting the room and paying the teacher. First-time attendees and dues-paying members pay only $5. We do not want price to be an obstacle for anyone attending class. Beginners have the option of purchasing a coupon booklet (good for 10 classes) for $30. Full-time students can always pay only $3 to attend. If these options don't work for you, please let me or one of the teachers know and other arrangements can be made.

Please don't be discouraged by the lack of RSVPs - many of our members do not belong to Meetup and so do not RSVP here. There will definitely be a crowd of dancers present!
results.how_to_find_us: Look for the red door in the lower level of the church on Sycamore St, and follow the sound of the music!

results.description:
Bagels & Bytes is technology-related peer learning and networking at its best!

Bring your tech questions, ideas, and issues. Join our fellowship of nonprofit techies (professional and "accidental" are equally welcome) as we brainstorm, share ideas and solutions, and support each other!

Both groups are very supportive and non-judgmental. There is no such thing as a "stupid" question at these meetings - all questions and topics for discussion are welcomed. We learn from each other in unexpected ways constantly, regardless of knowledge or skill levels. Hence, you don't have to be an "expert" techie to attend, just curious and interested in nonprofit technology. 

Bagels & Bytes is free to attend, but each attendee pays for his or her own meal off the menu.

results.description:
Geoff Tewksbury will be speaking about Microsoft Azure.

Microsoft Azure is an expansive (and growing) set of integrated cloud services (including web and mobile, predictive analytics, integration, identify management, infrastructure, media, etc.) that enable developers and architects to conceive, build, and deploy exciting and rich solutions with continuous agility and minimum friction.  Throughout the talk, we'll introduce the Azure ecosystem, with the goal of leaving everyone with the tools necessary to begin building and hosting applications leveraging the Azure platform.  Some areas of focus will include:

• The Azure Portal

• Developer Tools (Resource Manager, Visual Studio, PowerShell)

• App Services (including Web Apps and Logic Apps)

• Data Services (including Storage and DocumentDB)


About Geoff

Geoff is a Microsoft VTSP responsible for leading teams on large complex engagements, including technologies such as SharePoint, Windows Azure, Windows 8, ASP.NET, and Mobile solutions.  Over the last couple of years, Geoff has served as the Microsoft Azure team lead for CEI.  When his head isn’t in the clouds, Geoff and his two sons are typically wreaking havoc around his house.

Meeting Sponsor

CEI is sponsoring this month's meeting. Representatives will be in attendance if you are looking for more information on employment or services through CEI.
results.name: Azure overview for developers

results.description:
Join us on Tuesdays for American Mah Jong! Folks begin arriving around 5PM, and play begins table by table as soon as we have three or four players plus a set.  (We usually have 3-5 tables.)  By 6:15 or so, most players have arrived. We rotate among the tables... at the end of each game, East walks around to see if another table is close to the end of their game, so that two players can swap places.   At the other end of the evening... play must end by 9PM when Panera closes.  Tables begin wrapping up play any time after 8:15 or so.


If you have never played, or if you have not played for a very long time, we highly recommend that you take a Mah Jong 101 beginner class before playing with us - beginner classes are offered every few months.  Mah jong is a wonderful game, but it's hard to learn by just watching others play!


Please order your 2015 card from the National Mah Jongg League, here: http://www.nationalmahjonggleague.org/ Amazon.com also carries the cards. Note that you want the NMJL card, and no other! (There are some colorful alternatives out there.. but we play NMJL card and rules.)

Experienced players -- please bring your cards and please bring a set if you have one.

Please do not bring any outside food or beverages into Panera! Instead, please plan to buy *something* from Panera, even if it's just a beverage or a cookie, to support their willingness to host us.
results.how_to_find_us: Hard to miss us, look for the Mah Jong sets!
results.name: Mah Jong in Shadyside! (Note:  No beginner class tonight!)

results.description:
As we have crossed over into 2016 we are now in a new paradigm so even the nature of our work personally and with others has shifted dramatically from what was important even just 5 years ago.

In our first meet up of the new year we are going to have a  have a fun and interactive discussion about the three types of consciousness right now on the planet and how it’s shifting.

We’re going to delve deeply into why we need now more than ever to have a new love affair with our spirit and our authentic self and ways to develop our capacity to create and recognize that we are learning but we must take full responsibility for the experience we are having.

We will do a fun exercise and exploration into self awareness because If we are not self aware and we are doing intuitive or even healing work for others what we are really doing it reading our own window and projecting it onto someone else. This exercise will teach us how not to do that.

Look forward to seeing you there!

Blessings,

Joe

results.description:
For those beginner ukulele players in the South Hills of Pittsburgh, you can jam with other newer players at Mt. Lebanon Library the 2nd and 4th Tuesday of each month. This is for players who have had a few lessons or know some basic chords and want to learn more while playing with others. We will experiment with basic strums, alternate chords and how to move from one chord to the next. We will play songs slowly at first and then again, only faster. 


The group will decide what songs they want to play using "The Daily Ukulele 365 Songs for Better Living," by Liz and Jim Beloff. This book is available from local music stores and on line. 


Bring your ukulele and a floor music stand along with the music book. If you want to play songs other than what is in this book please notify the group the week prior so copies can be made. 


As the group progresses, we will introduce the group to more advanced players and more challenging music selections. 


If you have any questions, please contact Patty Williams at [masked].

results.description:
Join us for a 2-hour session of indoor volleyball open gym! You'll get a ton of playing time in a well-organized event. Our host will check players in, divide players into teams, and make sure that everything runs smoothly. All you have to do is show up ready to play!

Pricing:

• $7 - RSVP online and pay in advance (online rsvp closes at 4:30 pm!)

• $9 - RSVP and pay cash at the event

• $10 - Show up and play - be sure to check online to make sure there is room!

What to Wear: We are playing indoors on a rubberized all-sport surface. Most players wear volleyball-specific shoes, but gym shoes are also allowed. Please bring your shoes and change into them at the facility. This will help keep the floor clean of dirt and water.

What to Expect: Show up early! The games will begin at the time posted for this event. Players can start checking in with the event host as early as 15 minutes before the scheduled start time. If a court is available, you may begin warming up before the event begins. We limit play to 42 players per evening, which is 3 teams of 7 players per court. If we have 3 teams on a court, winners stay once and then shuffle out so everyone gets to play. If less people are in attendance, we divide based on who is there and mix things up half way through the session.

Level of Play: This event is open to all levels of play. We do our best to create even teams so that games are well-matched. Our ideal scenario is having one court of higher skilled players and one court of more recreational players. There are no referees, so players need to play with sportsmanship and make their own calls. We aim to make everyone feel welcome at these events.

Facility Information: Monroeville Sports Center is located at 855 Macbeth Drive in Monroeville. Parking should be ample in the free lot.

Minimum number of players and playing formats. This event needs a minimum of 12 people (not including the host) signed up before the start of the event in order to run. An email notification will be sent if we cancel. Refunds or credits will be issued if we cancel the event. Sign up early to encourage more people to sign up!!

Do Your Part! Help us keep an accurate guest count! If you RSVP, we're counting on you to be there. If you change your mind about playing or your guest count changes, please update your RSVP. No-Shows will be marked on your account. If space is tight, we hold RSVP spots 10 minutes into advertised start and then open spots to walk-ups.

Requirements to play: This is an adult volleyball group. You must be 19 older. Males and females of all skill levels are welcome to play. There is no required gender ratio. Players are expected to conduct themselves with good sportsmanship.

What's included in the price? Your payment helps to cover the rental costs, the hourly pay for your event host, and ensures a well-organized event.

Questions? Post your question in the comments section of this meetup and the event host or one of our organizers will reply. You can also message the organizers directly through meetup. Or, give us a call M-F 8:00am-12:30pm:[masked]-7130.
results.how_to_find_us: Check in with monitor

results.description:
Thinking of starting a business in 2016 but don't know where to start or what you should do first? Already have a business that is creating some challenges? Looking to find new growth strategies to increase revenue? Come to my Meetup and ask any questions you have about starting a business, running a business or being an entrepreneur. I want to help people and businesses become the best versions of themselves by making better decisions when it comes to business. I have found, as a business attorney and consultant, sometimes entrepreneurs and business owners just need someone to answer some basic questions to help them get out of their own way.  That is why I started this.

Each Meetup will be limited to 10 curious entrepreneurs and will last about an hour to an hour and a half.  Obviously, I cannot provide an legal advice at these Meetups, but I am happy to provide any business guidance you may need.  Hopefully the conversation will be good and the questions will be flowing. I hope you join me.

results.description:
With Angular 2 putting observables front and center, it makes sense to learn about them.

The Reactive Extensions for JavaScript (RxJS) is a set of libraries for composing asynchronous and event-based programs using observable sequences and fluent query operators that many of you already know by Array#extras in JavaScript. Using RxJS, developers represent asynchronous data streams with Observables, query asynchronous data streams using our many operators, and parameterize the concurrency in the asynchronous data streams using Schedulers. Simply put, RxJS = Observables + Operators + Schedulers.

Presenters are TBD. It'll either be Jeremy, Gabo, Steve, or some combination.
results.name: RxJS

results.description:
Another year, another time to reflect on the culture of software development. For decades, the two tribes of DEVELOPERS and QA have faced each other down on the battleground of SOFTWARE. In some lands, the tribes are continuously at war. In other places, they have forged an uneasy alliance. In precious few regions, they work together in HARMONY. Join PghQA as we explore this relationship, and seek to find a common ground where both tribes can flourish!

Speakers:

• Brian Hall (UPMC) - Brian is a QA Manager at UPMC/TDC, with experience in many software development roles (notably: development AND QA).

• Steve Gross (Google) - Steve is an SET ("Software Engineer in Test") at Google, with experience in test automation and DevOps.
results.name: PghQA - Dev vs. QA: Can't We All Just Get Along? Redux!

results.description:
Another year, another time to reflect on the culture of software development. For decades, the two tribes of DEVELOPERS and QA have faced each other down on the battleground of SOFTWARE. In some lands, the tribes are continuously at war. In other places, they have forged an uneasy alliance. In precious few regions, they work together in HARMONY. Join PghQA as we explore this relationship, and seek to find a common ground where both tribes can flourish!


Light snacks and drinks will be provided.

Please join us at BLVD Pub & Kitchen (114 Southpointe Blvd, Canonsburg, PA 15317) after the meetup to continue the conversation and socialize with your fellow attendees.

Speakers:

• Brian Hall (UPMC) - Brian is a QA Manager at UPMC/TDC, with experience in many software development roles (notably: development AND QA).

• Steve Gross (Google) - Steve is an SET ("Software Engineer in Test") at Google, with experience in test automation and DevOps.
results.name: PghQA - Dev vs. QA: Can't We All Just Get Along? Redux!

results.description:
A vision board is the physical, visual  manifestation of the changes you want to see in your life. Through the process of creating a Vision Board you are creating a virtual doorway - leave the past behind and enter into 2016 with a clear vision and plan. Through the process of visioning and creating, you learn how your inner insight and intention can lead to manifesting your visions. You deserve to live the best life possible, When you change your mind, you can change your life and live the dreams only you imagined.


This is a wonderful creation to participate in with liked minded individuals. The energy we can create in the room will propel the process of manifesting your dreams. 

Think of a vision board as a collage of images, pictures, and affirmations of your dreams, goals, and things that make you happy. It can also be called a dream board, treasure map, or vision map. Creating a vision board can be a useful tool to help you conceptualize your goals and can serve as a source of motivation as you work towards achieving your dreams.
We will provide the Poster Board, a few scissors and glue for you to create your vision on. If you could bring items to share such as magazines, extra scissors and glue, small trinkets, stickers, etc. that would be wonderful! 

To Prepare:

 Reflect on Key Words, Phrases, or Images that makes you LOVE life. Pause, wait and hear what intuitively comes to you - they may be metaphors or symbols. Recognize that everything that comes into your life you are attracting. You attract what most of your day is spent thinking of. Think of: What would you do differently when you realize your goal? Where would you travel? Where would you live? What would you wear? What things would you own? What would you do for work?...Or would you work? Who would you help?  What would Inner Peace look like? "Live What You Love" visualize as?  Define "Fulfilling Life"? Own Your Dreams? Become the Best Version of you?


Also here is a link to an article I wrote on this subject: 

http://www.holisticaging.com/vision-board-2016/
results.how_to_find_us: 100 yards North of Harts Run Road going North on Route 8 on the right or 100 yards South of Mount Royal Blvd. going South on Route 8 on the left.
results.name: Let us help one another manifest our dreams for 2016 by creating a VISION BOARD!

results.description: The name says it all! (hopefully!) Although this is more or less a presentation, by no means is this a lecture. The more interaction the better. As the organizer of this group, I wanted to create an atmosphere where people who have the heart to help raise money for the cause(s) they care about most could gather together with organizations in need of financial support in a social environment and share fundraising ideas and / or stories with one another. Being the president of a local branch of a national non profit organization, I'm looking forward to meeting others like myself and sharing what fundraising tools our branch uses. To be completely honest, one of the methods we are about to implement is so exciting I can't wait to share it with everyone! The cost to our organization to use this method is nothing, we can partner with other organizations (in fact, the more organizations we partner with, the more each organization will earn), and even the volunteers that actively participate in the campaign will earn money too! I know it may be a little hard to believe, but there are socially responsible corporations out there that have programs designed to give a portion of their profits back to non profit organizations. You'll be surprised and excited about many of the programs and methods that exists! I can't wait to share some of them with you all. Please bring paper and pen to take notes. Also, feel free to invite anyone you feel that could benefit from learning about new ways to fund raise. The more the merrier!

results.description:
$69/player special pricing good through Dec. 18th.  On the 19th, pricing goes up to $99 before season starts. Full teams and individuals have already signed up via our website. So don't be shy! 

Men’s & Coed League @ Cool Springs Sports Center...Brand NEW Facility in Bethel Park 

This is a BRAND NEW facility located about 20 minutes south of downtown. Two beautiful hard wood courts will be in play. Great locker rooms and amenities. This is an AMAZING value as we launch our new leagues and welcome new players. Note that this is a 6 week program to start. Winter will start in early January and returning fall teams will have priority placement.

Sign up as an individual - great way to meet new friends! - with a group of friends - or as a full team.  

Choose from:

Tuesday Coed or Men's - Rec Level (starts Jan 12th)

Wednesday Men's - Rec or Intermediate (starts Jam 13th)

What's included in the price? 

• 7 weeks of regular season plus up to two weeks of playoffs

• 2 paid referees + scorekeeper

• Two 20 minutes halves


• Championship prize for winning team: Choice of customized apparel or trophy!

• Food/Drink specials at sponsor bar

Format  
Full Court

When are we playing?  
This league plays a round robin regular season with game times rotating from 7:00 PM through 11:00 PM. A full season schedule and standings will be available on sportsmonster.net by week 2. 

Playing surface and what to wear:  
We play on a hardwood court. Athletic shoes are required. Teams must wear same-colored, permanent numbered shirts.

Level of competition:

- Recreational level is ideal for teams just forming, teams with a mix of experienced and novice players and maybe teams that have lost a step or two over the years and are looking for a more relaxed environment. 

- Intermediate level is for teams and players looking for a faster and more skilled atmosphere. Everyone playing has either played high school, club ball or IM's in college, knows the game and is solid in all fundamentals and sharp in certain skills. 


These leagues are happening! Don't see a bunch of people registered here? Don't worry! Many people and teams register directly on our sportsmonster.net website instead. So go ahead and sign up to play! 

Full Team Registration
*Want to Register as a Full Team? -- If you want to register a full team, you can do so but roster size MUST be at least 10. And yes, you can pay for all of them here. If players are signing up on their own, have each player/group be sure to reference one another so we know to place you together -- see questions when you RSVP. 

When will I find out which team I'm on? 
Once a team is formed, a roster will be provided to all the players and we ask someone from the team to volunteer to act as captain to ensure a full team is showing up each week and a positive vibe is maintained throughout the season. 

Don't have PayPal? You may register through Sportsmonster.net and pay by check or money order but you will be paying full value as presented on that site. 

If you have any questions please don't hesitate to ask.  
Call: [masked]
E-mail: ryan @ sportsmonster.net

All registrations made through this Meetup event agree to the terms and conditions found on sportsmonster.net.

results.description:
If you're into music, and even if you're not, here's a great opportunity to share any music you're interested in, have a cup of coffee or tea, and engage in conversation. We'll meet at Coffee Tree Roasters in Shadyside to chat, drink coffee, and listen to music. Bring your favorite music on your phone or thumb drive to share -- you can even bring an instrument to play if you'd like. And you can just come for the coffee and company – you absolutely aren't required to bring music (I will bring my laptop to look things up on YouTube as well).

Bring any music -- if you have music of your own creation, if you're passionate about a particular musician or band, or if you just like something and feel like sharing. It could be a recent find or something that influenced your childhood and got you though your teenage years. It could be something you love or it could even be something you hate -- just tell us why. Music is as much a story as anything -- it could be a story of you, or the story of the artist who created the music, or the story could be embedded in the song itself waiting for us to listen. Feel free to bring a story to share along with the music -- or not, if you prefer.

We're totally open to any kind of music so, please, bring anything you'd like to share be it classical, ethnic, heavy metal, or whatever -- even classical ethnic heavy metal (I bet it exists). We'll be meeting at Coffee Tree Roasters from 7pm (to probably 9pm though the room's booked until 10pm).

This event is also posted on meetin.org.
results.how_to_find_us: Inside Coffee Tree at 7pm, head to the glass-walled meeting room in the back.
results.name: Coffee Loves Music

results.description:
WHAT IS "Beginner Plus"

On Second Wednesdays, we play familiar tunes at a slower pace. You’ve already taken some lessons. Now it’s time to talk about some basic strums, alternate chord fingering, and how to move and slide between chords. Learn tricks, cheats and other valuable info geared to newer players and also to those who just like to hang out and play with a group. 

Below are basic chords, get comfortable with them. Notice how many chord changes take barely a slide of your fingers. Sometimes a finger just stays in place...

Key of C:  C  D7,   C    F,   F   G7,  G7   Am,  G7    C

Key of G:  G    D7,  G   C,  C  D7,  the barred D7 and Em,  G   Em,    D7    G

Key of F:  F    G7,    F    Bb,  F  C7,  Bb  C7, C7 Dm,  F  Dm ,  C7    F

Bring: Ukulele, music stand, tuner, music "TheDaily Ukulele - 365 Songs For Better Living" by Liz and Jim Beloff. Feel free to bring snacks n'at to share. We’ll have fun, and drink a little wine, too.  Marlene is host-leader. You’re invited.

The system I have used with my tutoring students is very effective and I use Skype in conjunction with an interactive White board as well as Quizlet and PDF files.

This is a free, online event that you can participate in from your computer. To join and get the access link, you must register at http://fi.co/webinars. If you can't make it, you can still register on that page to get the video recording approximately 72 hours after the event!  

----

The recent startup boom has created some of the world’s fastest growing new companies, and the strategies and methodologies they used can also be leveraged by employees and enterprises of all sizes to create innovation. 

If you would like to learn how, then join us on our free "How Employees Can Innovate Like Entrepreneurs" webinar.

This webinar will be hosted by Adeo Ressi (Founder & CEO of the Founder Institute), and feature special guest David Kidder, best-selling author of "The Startup Playbook", and Co-Founder and CEO of numerous successful companies - such as Clickable (acquired by Syncapse), SmartRay Network (acquired by LifeMinders), and Net-X (acquired by Target Vision). Through David’s most recent company, Bionic, he has helped some of the world’s largest companies become more entrepreneurial, like GE, Boeing, and Tyco. 

On this webinar you will learn: 

- How employees can adopt the same entrepreneurial strategies and tools used by the world’s most successful entrepreneurs 

- How employees can instill a “builder-mentality” in their organizations from the ground up 

- How company leaders can build an entrepreneurial culture in organizations of any size, to facilitate quick learning, risk taking, and exponential growth. 


We hope you will join us!

--- 

This is a free, online event that you can participate in from your computer. To join and get the access link, you must register at http://fi.co/webinars. If you can't make it, you can still register on that page to get the video recording approximately 72 hours after the event!

results.description:
There are over 50,000 residents living in Pittsburgh's Northside neighborhoods and until now there have been no open Toastmasters clubs for these communities. 

That changes with the establishment of the Northside Toastmasters to serve the community and develop its current and future leaders. In our meetings, members present prepared speeches, receive written and oral evaluations, practice impromptu speaking, and share fellowship in a supportive, non-intimidating environment. These experiences develop our members into greater communicators while practicing essential leadership skills. 

Toastmasters is a safe place to fail, to practice, to learn, and to grow into the best leader and communicator you can be. Come visit and find out what we can do for you! 

Current Toastmasters:

Please help us make this club a success and introduce this community to the incredible benefits Toastmasters has to offer. We need help spreading the word and ensuring that meetings run smoothly. If you are interested in volunteering to speak, fulfill a meeting role, or helping to promote the club; please let me know ASAP. If you are interested in sponsoring or mentoring this club (and earning credit toward your Advanced Leader Silver award in the process) please contact me directly. 


Thank you in advance for helping to bring the benefits of Toastmasters to the diverse and underserved communities of the Northside. Your involvement makes a difference!

Please note: The club will continue to meet at this location on the 2nd & 4th Thursday of each month from 6:30-7:30pm. Meetings are free and open to the public, all are welcome!

results.description:
Please join us for a wonderful "Secret Love Revealed" concert in the intimate setting of The Cloak Room at The Livermore. Hear Mendelssohn's String Quartet in Eb, secretly dedicated to the young woman who would crush his heart. Listen to Golijov's heart wrenchingly beautiful plea for peace in Jerusalem. Plus Gershwin's gorgeous Lullaby for Strings.

Concert Program: 
  
1. Felix Mendelssohn, String Quartet in E-flat-major, Op. 12 
  
2. Oswaldo Golijov - Tenebrae   

3. George Gershwin, Lullaby for Strings

For more information about these wonderful compositions, please read the Concert Program Notes section further below.

The musicians for this very special performance include:

   Anne Jackovic, First Violin
   Rochelle Agnew, Second Violin
   Katerina Istomin, Viola
   David Bennett, Cello


This concert is only $10 at the door.

The Cloak Room at The Livermore is located in the space formerly known as the Shadow Lounge. Check out these great articles

http://www.pghcitypaper.com/pittsburgh/the-cloak-room-steps-into-the-space-left-behind-by-shadow-lounge/Content?oid=1775485

http://www.nextpittsburgh.com/neighborhoods/east-liberty/eatdrink-the-cloakroom-queens-share-more/

In addition to the regular dinner menu, there will be some specialties for this event: 

   - veggie crostini with artichoke and olive
   - beef and pork meatballs with our house red sauce
   - vegetarian butternut squash caponata

For more information (including the regular menu, cocktails, etc.) about The Livermore, please visit  http://www.thelivermorepgh.com/

Concert Program Notes

Felix Mendelssohn, String Quartet in E-flat-major, Op. 12 (composed in 1829)

I. Adagio non troppo – Allegro non tardante II. Canzonetta. Allegretto (G minor) III. Andante espressivo IV. Molto allegro e vivace

I am composing a quartet for you,” Mendelssohn told Betty Pistor.

Without her knowledge, he secretly added the initials B.P. above his autograph on the score.  Betty was a neighbor and the daughter of a Berlin astronomer, a year older than Felix, and sang in the choir he accompanied on Friday nights in Berlin. Mendelssohn's romantic feelings for Betty were never reciprocated,

Further analysis of the score shows how the Allegro movement uses the notes Bb - Eb, in German B - Es, three letters extracted from Betty's name (this theme is also echoed in the fourth movement).

A very unusual feature of the quartet is that every movement is set in a different key (E-flat major, G Minor, B-flat major and C Minor).

Mendelssohn was very much entrenched in the works of Beethoven at the time, and the quartet certainly reflects his influence. His later quartets return to a more formal classical style, however the Eb quartet evokes a somewhat restless wildness reminiscent of Beethoven.

The Canzonetta (second movement) replaces the traditional scherzo. The movement features delicate pizzicato accompaniment with a fanciful middle section that recalls the composer's Overture to "A Midsummer Night's Dream." The Andante espressivo is a romantic song without words. The Molto allegro e vivace completes the work with a stormy tempest.

Manfred Lehmann writes,"I recently heard Mendelssohn's String Quartet in E-flat Major, Opus 12, and was struck with the Jewish-sounding themes, especially in the first movement, which could have been taken out of the Kol Nidre melody." Felix was born a Jew, the grandson of the great Jewish philosopher Moses Mendelssohn. but was baptized as a Lutheran Protestant as a young boy.  Although there has been much discussion regarding Mendelssohn's religious beliefs, he was born into a very tortuous period in Jewish history.

Oswaldo Golijov - Tenebrae  (2002)

Golijov was born to Romanian Jewish parents living in La Plata, Argentina. His mother was a piano teacher mother and his father a physician. He was exposed to classical music, Jewish liturgical music, klezmer and tango. After studying piano at the local conservatory and composition with Gerardo Gandini he moved to Israel in 1983, where he studied with Mark Kopytman at the Jerusalem Rubin Academy. Upon moving to the United States in 1986, Golijov earned his Ph.D. at the University of Pennsylvania, where he studied with George Crumb.

In 2002 he was commissioned to write a piece for the Spoleto Music Festival in Charleston, SC. The festival performed version 1 of his Tenebrae, written for soprano, clarinet and string quartet. Version 2 was later arranged for string quartet.

Here are the composer's notes:

"I wrote Tenebrae as a consequence of witnessing two contrasting realities in a short period of time in September 2000. I was in Israel at the start of the new wave of violence that is still continuing today, and a week later I took my son to the new planetarium in New York, where we could see the Earth as a beautiful blue dot in space. I wanted to write a piece that could be listened to from different perspectives. That is, if one chooses to listen to it "from afar", the music would probably offer a "beautiful" surface but, from a metaphorically closer distance, one could hear that, beneath that surface, the music is full of pain. I lifted some of the haunting melismas from Couperin's Troisieme Leçon de Tenebrae, using them as sources for loops, and wrote new interludes between them, always within a pulsating, vibrating, aerial texture. The compositional challenge was to write music that would sound as an orbiting spaceship that never touches ground. After finishing the composition, I realized that Tenebrae could be heard as the slow, quiet reading of an illuminated medieval manuscript in which the appearances of the voice singing the letters of the Hebrew Alphabet (from Yod to Nun, as in Couperin) signal the beginning of new chapters, leading to the ending section, built around a single, repeated word: Jerusalem."

George Gershwin, Lullaby for Strings  (1919)

George Gershwin wrote his Lullaby for strings in 1919, and it was performed often at private musicales held by Gershwin's friends. In

1967 the quartet received it's first public performance by the Juilliard String Quartet.  In 1968, Ira Gershwin wrote, “It may not be the Gershwin of Rhapsody in Blue, Concerto in F, and his other concert works, but I find it charming and kind.”

Additional Notes

Mendelssohn's cryptic dedication is more commonly used than we may think. The most famous musical cryptogram was by J. S. Bach. Here are some famous instances of the practice:

A, E♭, C, B♮ (A, S, C, H) and (A♭, C, B♮ As, C, H)
used in Schumann's Carnaval, Op. 9. He was romantically involved with Ernestine von Fricken, who came from the town of Asch.

[A], E♭, C, B♮, B♭, E(♮), G for ([A], S, C, H, B, E, G)
for Arnold Schoenberg (A. Schönberg)

B♭, A, C, B♮ for (B, A, C, H)
for Johann Sebastian Bach

B, A, D, D, G for (H, A, Y, D, N)
for Joseph Haydn, used by Maurice Ravel in his Menuet sur le nom d'Haydn

B, E, B, A or B, A, B, E for Béla Bartók (Béla Bartók)

D, E♭, C, B for (D, S, C, H)
for Dmitri Shostakovich (D. Schostakowitsch)

F, E♭, C, B for (F, S, C, H)
for Franz Schubert (F. Schubert)

Get Heard! Get Noticed! Get Leads! (TM)

Hosted by: Denise LaRosa of the blog Mom Talk and Edie Coates from Ace In the Hole Entertainment.

This is an informal networking event, open to any business woman who would like to increase her business contacts or clients in the Monroeville area.

Things to bring:

- 10-20 business cards or marketing material

- cash for your lunch check

- $5 meeting fee (non members only)


AGENDA

1:00 pm - attendees arrive, reviews menu, gives the server their drink order, and open networking: everyone stands up to introduce oneself to others and pass their business card

1:15 pm - server takes lunch order and the sign in sheet is passed around

1:30 pm - 60 sec. commercials begin

2:00 pm - each person gives a testimony or referral for someone attending the lunch

2:15 pm - Premier member does a 5 min. company presentation

2:20 pm - WSBA announcements from Debi/Susan

2:30 pm - lunch has ended. Open networking is welcomed.

Be prepared to do a 60 second commercial about yourself. Please RSVP if you plan to attend this lunch. If your schedule becomes free the day of the lunch, then you may attend without an RSVP. This lunch is subject to cancellation when the lunch has 3 or less RSVPs.Lunch cancellation policy.

If you are not a WSBA member and would like to attend as a guest, please email Debi Arnett @ [masked]


If you have an interest in becoming a General member ($50/year) or Premier member ($100/year) of WSBA, please contact <a>Debi Arnett </a>or [masked]

Any non member will be removed from this site, if they RSVP and they do not attend.
results.name: WSBA The Network Lunch TM-Monroeville

results.description:
Hello everyone!

What a great start to 2016!  

We had fifteen gamers under the lights throughout Friday night at Kings.  It was great seeing many of our regulars return for the New Year but we also had some fresh faces join us to play some games.  

Kings is an pretty nice venue and moving up the start time to 5:00 has been a big success.  So I went ahead and reserved all of the Friday nights in January so look for meetups to be posted for the remainder of the month.  

We had three to four tables playing games all through the night and played some fabulous games like:  Ticket to Ride - PA Expansion, Alien Frontiers, Catan, Blood Rage, Raptor, Last Will, Libertalia, and many others.  Once again 11:00 PM came way too soon but everyone seemed to have a great time.  


This week's featured theme is:  Bring your favorite game - part deux! 

I should have a couple of new Euro Games (Voyages of Marco Polo, Mombasa) arriving this week so I will bring them with me.  I will also bring Orleans since it is one of my new favorites.  If you would like to play any of those just leave a message down in the chat. 

Please r.s.v.p. early so I have an idea on how many people or coming and what games to bring along.  You can always cancel your r.s.v.p. if you have a change of plans.


See you on Friday!

Russ.
results.name: Friday Night under the Lights!

results.description:
http://www.carnegiesciencecenter.org/programs/adult-programs-21-plus-night/

Blast off with 21+ Rocket Science!

We're teaming up with City Theatre to explore the space race and the science of rockets. City Theatre will present the world premiere of "Some Brighter Distance," which explores the true story of Arthur Rudolph, a German rocket scientist who helped American win the space race before being cast out of the country. Preview scenes from the play even before its theatrical debut on Jan. 23. Actors will perform under the stars in the Buhl Planetarium; a planetarium show will follow the performance.

Bring your questions for a Q-and-A session with some of the cast and crew and astronomers to learn about this important time in American history.

All that, plus:

Watch as we ignite your curiosity with explosive demonstrations in our Works Theater.
Design and launch your own straw-rocket.
Take a ride on our zero-gravity simulator.
Build a space shuttle glider.
In the Science Stage, watch vintage films depicting what people thought space travel would be like in the future.
results.name: Carnegie Science Center 21+ Night

results.description:
Don't Miss Out On Pittsburgh‘s Most Exciting New Dating Concept…

Speed Dating with a (Painting) Twist

If you're a single professional ages 25+ you don’t want to miss this because we’re doing something a little different.

Speed Dating AND a Painting Party!

12 Dates in 1 Night, unlike anything you’ve ever experienced before.

NO awkward conversations with a stranger across a table.

NO scrambling to come up with interesting things to talk about.

Only fun and genuine connections with great people. You’re going to give your canvas a big ole “Wet Kiss” and swap it with your dates to see what artistic folly will result!

https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/GnF9NIQPv2fjkdw_iqiKLWxfNH9-URqB8o8P7bl8Fj2K1C_s1Pts3Fg_ntaSuJYr7HiGg1pmEaK56WVS_PKcPAiI-puf8TkRGHEYFtl2tjCl5HMXFB8g3CjTSsEy51CQrnolVHka

P.S. It's okay if you're a few years outside of this range, please feel free to attend.

Tickets:

$45 prepay - includes paint and one canvas

$60 at the door -- If you just show up we cannot guarantee that we'll be able to accommodate you, so get your tickets now!

BYOB as the venue doesn’t serve alcohol or food

Purchase Prepay tickets here: http://www.danitawalton.com/events/play-dating/painting/

https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/Xv1Ue5L3E-cJGKio7ouW7vDlq-yfl98iHfIwsCLvSfxkbZvg1e0DPtuSSmWwb7OhTYggp_GKJaus-VY7v7BALretyIHVzz8T8X5fLM_q0ejzjIuZsbSkjwFEW4F2ypHg4HKkTh_m


This spontaneous event is a combination of Game Night and Speed Dating. Join other fun and friendly singles for a casual and comfortable party like no other!

Here is how it works…

~ Upon arrival you will be greeted by the friendliest host you’ve ever met and given a name tag, as well as a sheet to keep track of everyone you meet

~ Time to Play: every 6 minutes you will rotate seats and switch canvases with your 6 minute date

~ At the end of the night let us know the people you would like to see again.

~ If the feeling’s mutual, we will exchange your contact information.

https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/6vzEtAjUMYbcZCUVxFOmT7Qf9CPOLPfx0EzluG9voDvRCNMj3UkybON5NNAZP34VTrvufkpXVKTzo4MT41DEZm1_iS6EEXs0WoPsBBaMOHTggmbhxSCBFBz_ux5rNTewWFJacqvc


Common Questions:

What if I don’t have a match?

Even if you don’t have a match, we’ll give you the the contact information for those who are interested in you. You never know what might happen!

Can I come alone?

Yes 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.

What are the age ranges?

This event will cater mostly to single professionals in their 20s, 30s, 40s, and 50s however we have events for all kinds of demographics. Check out our Meetup Group Relationship Ready Singles - Pittsburgh for more coming events (http://www.meetup.com/relationship-ready-singles-burgh/ )

How is this different from other speed dating events?

The brainchild of matchmaker, Danita Walton, Play Dating is a unique dating concept centered around the premise of spontaneity, fun, and connection.

Should you meet your Mr. or Mrs. right we want you to be able to tell the story as if we were never there. So forget about meeting someone and just come out and have some fun!

Purchase Prepay tickets here: http://www.danitawalton.com/events/play-dating/painting/
results.name: Play Dating, Speed Dating with a (Painting) Twist

results.description:
At this breakfast, Russell Livingston, President of Babb, Inc. will be sharing what he believes to be the most important leadership lesson for the next generation. 

Russell's Bio: 

Russell is a 29-year veteran of the health insurance industry and is President of Babb, Inc. He graduated from Westminster College in 1984, and has been a regular participant in the University of Pittsburgh Katz School of Business Executive Education Program, as well as the Wharton School Certified Employee Benefits Specialist Program. Russell holds the HIPAA Designation as a "Managed HealthCare Professional" and is a Certified PPACA Specialist, a program offered through the National Association Health Underwriters.

Babb, Inc. is one of the oldest and largest insurance brokerage, consulting, and third-party administration firms in the state of Pennsylvania. Babb's third party administration business includes the administration and management of self-insured Employee Benefit claims and Workers' Compensation. At Babb, Russell is responsible for the management of the business and key client relationships. Russell is well-known as a leader and innovator in the field. Babb has offices in Pittsburgh PA; Wayne PA; Altoona PA; and Ft. Myers FL.

His professional memberships include: The Self-Insurance Institute of America, National Association of Health Insurance Underwriters, American College Health Association, National Association of Employee Benefits Administrators, Pittsburgh Association of Group Executives, YPO, WPO and Western PA Highmark Blue Cross Agency Advisory Board. 

Active in the non-profit community, Russell was a co-founder of Pittsburgh's Silent Partners and has served on the Board of Directors of the March of Dimes. He is currently a member of the Passavant Memorial Homes Foundation Board and Young Life Fox Chapel.

In order to bring a greater depth of knowledge in Babb's client deliverable, Russell has served as a Board Member in the Hospital, Emergency Medical Services and Long Term Care fields. Russell has served on the Alle-Kiski Medical Center Board of Directors since 2009, and also serves on the Board of Directors of Oberg Industries.

results.description:
FREE Indoor Cycling Class At Your Pittsburg Performance Bicycle Store.

Your Pittsburg Performance Bicycle Store is holding a free indoor cycling class that’s designed to be fun, low-key and give you a great introduction to indoor cycling.

While the class promises a great workout that will help you kick-start your fitness plans,you don’t have to worry about flashing lights, loud music or an instructor who thinks they’re training everyone for an Ironman.

Everyone has to start somewhere, and your local Performance Bicycle Store is a great place to introduce yourself to indoor cycling. That’s why everyone is welcome.

When: Every Saturday at 9am.

Duration: Class is one hour

Instructor:  A friendly and supportive store employee

What you need to bring:  a bike, a trainer, water bottle, towel,

Optional: fan, trainer mat, nutrition, wheel riser block

Hope to see you there.  If you have any questions, please call your local Performance Bicycle Store.

Enjoy your workout!
results.how_to_find_us: Village of Eastside
results.name: Join us for Free Beginner Indoor cycling Class

results.description:
Sat Jan 9 UPDATE:  I've some email from members asking me about the location and whether this is 'still happening'.  Yes, of course.  And I look forward to it.  This class is for people who have never taken French before OR need a gentler approach.  This couse will include:

• online discussion site

• vocabulary and phrases on quizlet and google docs

• recorded audio

• practical phrases

Also, I am expecting a basic commitment of 8 weeks at a time as regular study is important and I don't want you starting and dropping out - this will be hard on the group.  I will be focussing on authentic French and essential vocabulary and phrases.

Sorry I didn’t update this earlier  Note - we are meeting at a new Paneras so be sure to update your gps or be on the lookout for it. It’s a new “mall” development off of north mcKnight :

Panera Bread Covenant Ave Store #204347

8800 Covenant Ave.

Pittsburgh PA

Phone[masked]

Materials will be distributed online for participating members.

Fee is $10 for the 2 hours.

Just a reminder: if you cannot come for whatever reason please be so kind as to cancel your RSVP online. That helps let me not print so many docs. And gives your spot them someone else. Merci!


This will be supplemented with other grammar / vocabulary. You can always get in touch with me through my  on Meetup Page

Marc Snyder

[masked] = feel free to call or text me

or email @ [masked] (my official teaching email)

Bonjour!


This week we be reviewing chapter 1-5 in beg. and continuing with 17-18 in French in action. 

This is for all beginning and intermediate levels.  I'm going to offer this 4x a month (with occasional cancellations).  The location might vary a bit but will be in shadyside/sq. hill for now. The focus of the group is on communication strategies (improving your conversational skills).

The session will be divided into 2 parts:

• Beginning (10-11)
Textbook we are using now is FRENCH IN ACTION (any edition).  I have pdf copies of other materials. ch 1 - 26

Intermediate (11-12) FRENCH IN ACTION ch 27 - 52

You are welcome to stay for both sections.

Just a reminder:  if you cannot come for whatever reason please be so kind as to cancel your RSVP online. That helps let me not print so many docs. And gives your spot them someone else. Merci!

This will be supplemented with other grammar / vocabulary.

results.description:
Were your News Years resolutions to exercise more AND to help spread the word about Bernie Sanders? Well you're in luck! 

Meeting place is on Washington's Landing, in the Public Parking lot across from Redfin Blues.  Roughly a 3.1 mile, 5k loop between the 16th and 31st bridges.   Can split up into walkers and joggers if enough people. Wear your bernie gear, I'll bring some left over pins, stickers, some pamplets and flyers to distribute.  Plan is to go down the river trail from 16th to 31st bridge, then thru the Strip District, back to the 16th street bridge.  The primary goal is that by wearing some Bernie gear we help to raise awareness about Bernie's presidential campaign (for those who don't know of him), stirring some interest, and hopefully getting some people to research who Bernie is and what he stands for.  Bernie shirts and pins also generally elicit cheers from fellow supporters, who we can ask to check out local volunteer opportunities for nationally important tasks, such as phone banking.

First time I'm trying this, so I'm open to suggestions.  I figured Washinton's Landing was an easy place to meet up because its free to park, and the distance of run/walk isn't too far.  

I'll be there rain/snow/shine, hope to see you there!

Hosted by Patrick Duffey, [masked]
results.how_to_find_us: Take the 31st street exit from Rt. 28. Go towards River Road, and down the 30th street bridge, which is really just a little ramp onto the island. Parking lot is first one on your left.
results.name: Bernie Jogs/Walks (5k) thru the Strip District, Pittsburgh

results.description:
Raw acai chia falooda, fermented green tea salad and more...

Pictured: Buffalo cauliflower drumsticks, black lentil fritters with tamarind dipping sauce, Virgin Mary shots, raw cacao walnut brownies

Gluten free, vegan, soy free, unprocessed and with no refined sugar......yes, it's possible.

A part of the monthly Saturday Superfood Brunch series, this is a one-of-a-kind slow food event that typically runs for 2-3 hours, allowing guests to eat mindfully, socialize, network, have intellectual conversations, get informed about healing superfood ingredients and enjoy themselves while the food comes out course after course. By eating mindfully and not loading up on empty calories and carbs, guests leave more than full, nourished and satisfied. This is not a buffet, and table manners will be expected.

Milestones:

http://www.pghcitypaper.com/pittsburgh/extraveganza-offers-pittsburghers-a-slow-food-brunch/Content?oid=1866187 

http://vstw.net/2015/04/an-evolution-of-eating/

http://www.muddymelissa.com/2015/04/12/review-zest-wishes-vegan-brunch/

http://www.azula.com/healthy-seaweed-recipes/ 

http://pittsburgh.cityvoter.com/best/brunch/great-meals/pittsburgh 

http://www.post-gazette.com/life/munch/2014/08/28/Munch-goes-to-Schwartz-Living-Market/stories/201408280139 

http://www.wonderaddo.com/index.php/family-friendly-vegan-brunch/ 

http://www.pittsburghmagazine-digital.com/pittsburghmagazine/january_2014/?pg=104&pm=1&u1=friend#pg104 

http://www.post-gazette.com/life/recipes/2013/09/19/Food-Column-Cook-and-learn-at-pop-up-dinner/stories/201309190282

http://www.greenbrideguide.com/blog/want-create-plant-based-gluten-free-wedding-menu-dont-be-scared

http://www.popcitymedia.com/features/creativedinners0918.aspx

Enjoy a-whole-new-level vegan brunch items crafted by Chef Mya Zeronis of Lean Chef en Route/extraVEGANza Pgh, using GMO-free, local, organic ingredients and NO refined sugar, gluten, processed textured mock meats, vegetable protein isolates TVPs and processed vegan cheeses. A chef who weighs 98 pounds, Mya Zeronis started cooking plant-strong Burmese farm food in her parents’ kitchen at the age of 11. Despite her decade-long career in conventional, meat-centric, butter-drowned, flour-covered and sugar-coated U.S. restaurant kitchens, she identified a need for healthful foods in Pittsburgh and made it her business in 2013. By returning to her roots, she resolved some of her health issues resulted from eating whatever was readily available in restaurant kitchens. Her multifaceted business (personal chef and catering services, raw organic juice bar, vegan whole food cafe and monthly plant-based superfood brunches) aims to make healthy eating and sustainable living accessible. Nearly a dozen of her recipes won top prizes in national and local contests. Some others were published in magazines and cookbooks. Her monthly vegan, gluten-free brunch is discovered by foodies from as far as Austin.

[4 BEVERAGES] Juice counter for make-your-own raw fresh juice blends: Orange Glow - carrots, Mandarin oranges, ginger; Virgin Mary - tomatoes, celery, banana peppers, garlic, lemon, pink Himalayan salt 

Raw vegan nog with coconut milk, bananas, cinnamon, nut mag, cloves, turmeric, nutritional yeast, vanilla 

Organic, fair-trade coffee with homemade almond milk and grade B dark organic maple syrup

[10 DISHES] See ticket link. 

This is reservation-only event and guests must pay in advance. Cutoff is 48 hours prior to event. Want to get this brunch and upcoming brunches for $15 each? Sign up for a one-year Born To Brunch membership (link below). 

Up to two children age 7 or younger, accompanied by paying adult, eat free. For each additional child or those 8-14, the cost is $10 and it's donated to No Kid Hungry. 

Please email organizer well in advance if you have any food sensitivities and allergies. If bringing children under 7 years of age, please let organizer know how many.

http://jan16brunch.brownpapertickets.com
results.name: Intercontinental Superfood Brunch

results.description:
We share this information with you because it is a metaphysics event in Pgh that you may enjoy attending.  Here are the details about this event:

Part 1 of a three part learning experience to discover innate intuition within yourself, and once found how to use it to self-empower, spiritually grow and enhance your life.

Follow-up meetings are scheduled for February 13, and March 12 at the Squirrel Hill Library, Room C.

Intuition is like a spiritual muscle, if left unattended and not used becomes dormant and resides deep within your consciousness. Once you acknowledge your intuition and accept its power to move you in directions that include the spirit realm, an illumination occurs to shine light on a once hidden way of experiencing.

Listening to your inner voice is often suggested, but we must first know just what that is. The group "Finding Your Intuitive Voice" will inform you how to know your voice, and through group work will practice using your intuition so it becomes second nature to live a life intuitively.

Facilitator is Suzanne Bishop, a nationally known psychic medium who is from Pittsburgh. To learn more about intuition and the psychic world discover Intuit Now at http://intuitz.com
results.name: Finding Your Intuitive Voice

results.description:
This is one of our weekly sessions. Class begins at 7:00 with instruction on basic footwork and formations, allowing everyone to participate in some fun social dances. From about 8:00 until 10:15, we have a Social Class - the focus is on more experienced dancers and complex dances, but beginners are encouraged to stay and watch, and participate in some of the simpler dances. At some point in the evening, we will break for a spot of tea and other refreshments.

Beginners are always welcome, no partner necessary. (In fact, you will be encouraged to dance with more experienced dancers rather than with other beginners.)

The $7.00 fee per person for each class covers the cost of renting the room and paying the teacher. However, we do not want price to be an obstacle for anyone attending class. Beginners have the option of purchasing a coupon booklet (good for 10 classes) for $30. Full-time students can always pay only $3 to attend. If these options don't work for you, please let me or one of the teachers know and other arrangements can be made.

Please don't be discouraged by the lack of RSVPs - many of our members do not belong to Meetup and so do not RSVP here. There will definitely be a crowd of dancers present!

results.description:
To Listen is to Love


" The Law of silence is easier to learn if you're more willing to just listen to others instead of having to pummel them with your great wisdom."

– Sri Harold Klemp, Ask the Master, p 127

The Eckankar Center of Western PA invites you to gather with others who have been touched by God’s love.


The ECK Worship Service lasts about one hour and is made up of three spiritual parts.  It begins with a short and uplifting reading from the works of Eckankar.  Following the reading, everyone is invited to sing HU, an ancient name for God.  The song of HU can open one’s heart to the love of God.  Anyone can benefit from this song of spiritual love regardless of age, background, or religion.  The HU song closes with a few moments of quiet contemplation and is followed by an open discussion of the morning’s topic.

For more information, visit:

<a>Http://www.meetup.com/eckankarofpa</a>

(Sponsored by the Pennsylvania Satsang Society, Inc. a Chartered Affiliate of ECKANKAR. Religion of the Light and Sound of God.)

~and~

<a>Http://www.eckankar.org</a>

Official main site of ECKANKAR, Religion of the Light and Sound of God 

~also~


To hear the HU Song, visit <a>www.hearhu.org.</a>

<a>
</a>

For information on Western PA Eckankar events call:[masked]

The terms ECKANKAR, ECK, and Mahanta among others are trademarks of ECKANKAR. Copyright© 2015 ECKANKAR all rights reserved. P.O.Box 2000, Chanhassen, MN[masked]

results.description:
From Goodreads:
An audacious, darkly glittering novel set in the eerie days of civilization's collapse, Station Eleven tells the spellbinding story of a Hollywood star, his would-be savior, and a nomadic group of actors roaming the scattered outposts of the Great Lakes region, risking everything for art and humanity.

A novel of art, memory, and ambition, Station Eleven tells a story about the relationships that sustain us, the ephemeral nature of fame, and the beauty of the world as we know it.

The author Emily St. John Mandel will be in Pittsburgh on Monday, February 15, and some members of the book already have tickets.

http://pittsburghlectures.org/monday-night-lecture-series/emily-st-john-mandel/
results.name: _Station Eleven_ by Emily St. John Mandel

results.description:
Please join the Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra (PSO) for a stirring concert performance featuring the works of Beethoven as well as Philip Glass and the Italian composer Ottorino Respighi.

Artists

    Christoph König, conductor
    Tim Fain, violin (debut)

Program

    Respighi: Overture to Belfagor 

    Glass: Concerto No. 2 for Violin and Orchestra, “The American Four Seasons” (Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra premiere) 

    Beethoven: Symphony No. 6 in F major, Opus 68, “Pastoral"

About This Performance

The Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra and young American violinist Tim Fain will perform Philip Glass’ second violin concerto “The American Four Seasons,” which is considered a modern counterpart to Vivaldi’s popular Four Seasons. German conductor Christoph König returns to the podium, and, along with Glass’ concerto, will conduct the orchestra in a performance of Beethoven’s Symphony No. 6. One of his most charming symphonies, it paints a picture of nature and a man’s feelings toward it.

Check out these great articles and reviews of the concert http://triblive.com/aande/music/9779696-74/beethoven-konig-respighi#axzz3xT7hZvte

http://www.post-gazette.com/ae/music-reviews/2016/01/16/Concert-review-PSO-offers-winning-Glass-Beethoven/stories/201601160066

http://triblive.com/aande/music/9745136-74/symphony-konig-music#axzz3xEWDaEc6

http://www.post-gazette.com/ae/music/2016/01/10/Music-of-Philip-Glass-of-America-s-leading-composers-Pittsburgh-Heinz-Hall-Tim-Fain-American-Four-Seasons-Concerto-Violin/stories/201601100083

For more information about Italian composer Ottorino Respighi (1879 – 1936), please visit https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ottorino_Respighi

For more information about American composer Philip Glass, please visit https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philip_Glass

FOR TICKETS - PSO Concert

1) Because of the general desire for cheaper tickets and people that would like to sit together, one approach is to buy at the door so we'll have a good feel of attendance as compared to buying all the tickets in advance and hoping everyone can make the show. 

2) If anyone is interested in a discount for this show -- where you'll pay about $25 per ticket (where you'll save up to $10 per ticket plus another $6 in avoided ticket handling fees while sitting together as a group).  Please be at the Heinz Hall Box Office at 1:15 PM. Please bring cash as the exact amount will depend on how many people are at the Box Office at 1:15 PM so we can finalize the order quickly. 

Of importance is that the group also has the opportunity to attend a 1:30 PM pre-concert discussion inside Heinz Hall to learn more about this very interesting performance to enhance your concert experience.

3) If anyone is a student or senior, please follow the PSO guidelines for obtaining rush tickets (also usually with a discount) http://www.pittsburghsymphony.org/pso_home/web/faq#rush

4) Others are certainly welcome to arrange for their own tickets; for example, if they are already subscribers or prefer to order their own tickets anyway.  This can be done by visiting or calling the Heinz Hall Box Office [masked]), visiting or calling the Theater Square Box Office [masked]) or going online http://www.pittsburghsymphony.org/production/43791/beethovens-pastoral

As always, it is also fine if you'd like to attend this concert on your own with family/friends instead.

Also, if you can't make the Sunday matinee performance, please consider attending the other performance on Friday January 15 or Saturday January 16 at 8 PM.  For more information and ticket availability about this concert (January 15-17) at Heinz Hall, please visit http://www.pittsburghsymphony.org/production/43791/beethovens-pastoral

For more information about the PSO and other concerts coming up, please visit http://www.pittsburghsymphony.org/pso_home

Stay tuned for updates!

Parking Here is the ParkPGH website with real-time info on downtown parking garage availability http://parkpgh.org where you can also download apps, get garage availability via text messaging, etc. You can also call[masked]-8980.
results.how_to_find_us: For discount tickets, please meet inside Heinz Hall Box Office by 1:15 PM.  There will also be a very interesting 1:30 PM pre-concert discussion.
results.name: Beethoven’s Pastoral -- Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra (with discount tickets)

results.description:
7th Annual Antique & Collectible Identification by
the Historical Glass Club of Pittsburgh
Sunday, January 17, 1:30 PM

The Historical Glass Club of Pittsburgh will hold its 7th
annual antiques and collectible identification event in
cooperation with Mt. Lebanon Public Library. The
club’s team of appraisers will attempt to verbally
identify all types of antiques and collectibles, including
pottery, china, glass, toys, coins, furniture, primitives,
and ephemera.

If you wish to have your items examined, please bring
them to the lower level of the library. Cost is $5 for
two antique and collectible identifications. In addition,
Mt. Lebanon Public Library offers patrons access to the
database Price It! Antiques and Collectibles powered
by Worth Point. Ask at the reference desk for details
and further information.
results.name: 7th Annual Antique & Collectible Identification by Historical Glass Club of Pgh
