results.description:
Please sign up if you're planning on playing and bring your favorite games!  Newbies are very welcome.  We have some great teachers to help you get started on your gaming adventure.  Let us know when you sign up what game(s) you'll be bringing.  On Sundays there is plenty of free parking on the side streets and even right on Murray.  Crazy Mocha serves great coffee, specialty drinks, snacks and pastries.  They do allow us to bring food in if we take our trash with us. We usually play all day, break for dinner around 6:00, then it's back to gaming until everybody poops out. 

Incidentally, many of our regular players no longer bother to sign up (but I really wish they would!), so if it looks like only  one or two people are coming, there could actually be quite a few more.  Remember, I will always cancel a game Meetup if we aren't gaming that day, so you won't be sitting there all by yourself waiting for a friend.    And please, remember to change your rsvp to no if you can't make it that day!

$1.00 will be charged to help cover the fee Meetup charges and to buy games for the group.  Join us and let the games begin!!!
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be the ones playing games.
results.name: Play Eurogames!

results.description:
Click Here


Our Dog Day Afternoon Hike at Hartwood Acres Park is a great way to take your four legged friend out on an adventure – plus a great opportunity for you and your pet to make new friends, have some laughs, get some exercise and enjoy the beautiful outdoors. We will do a short hike around the grounds. All dogs must be on a leash and under control.


Thank you for your interest in our free "Dog Day Afternoon Hike Outing." L.L.Bean has a centralized reservation system. To guarantee your space, you must first confirm your reservation on our centralized reservation system, and if appropriate, fill out a participant agreement. Please visit www.llbean.com/pittsburgh, find this event on the "Event Calendar", and register. We look forward to seeing you!

Activity Level:
Physical Ability/Cardiovascular Demand: Easy
Level of Experience: Intro

Hike distance will be ~4 miles.

Learn the skills for a lifetime of adventure: 
  • L.L.Bean Outdoor Discovery Schools LLBean.com/Adventure 
</a>

What to bring:
Dress in Layers (avoid Cotton)
Hiking Boots or Shoes with Tread
Water to stay hydrated
Snacks
Completed and signed L.L.Bean participant agreement <a href="http://files.meetup.com/3349842/Participant_Agreement_Form_110514.pdf">Click Here

Optional: Optics, Lip Balm, Camera, Change of Shoes, Dry Bag, Walking Stick or Trekking Poles, Personal Medicines, Eye Protection

Minimum Age 8: This outing is open to dogs and humans. Humans ages 8 and above. Children 8 to 14 years of age need to be accompanied by a participating adult. Children 15 to 17 years old can participate alone after their parent has signed the L.L.Bean participant agreement for minors.

Dog-friendly: Leashed (6' leash please), people friendly, vaccinated, well socialized outdoor dogs are welcome on the hike.

Need help preparing for your next adventure? Visit L.L.Bean Store at Ross Park Mall and ask to speak with an Outdoor Product Specialist. L.L.Bean will fit you with the right clothing and gear for all of life's adventures.

L.L.Bean Store at Ross Park Mall
1000 Ross Park Mall Drive (Map)
Pittsburgh, PA  15237
L.L.Bean Outdoor Discovery Schools
Website | Meetup | Twitter | Facebook

results.description:
Let us come together to build a community of meditators and spread the benefits of meditation among Pittsburghers. So come and join with us in a Joyful meditation for health and happiness and tell the whole city "I Meditate Pittsburgh." :-)

There are no prerequisites and all above 12 yrs of age are welcome to join. Consider telling your friends and bring them along.

Event will be simple. We will start with some introduction to meditation, do some gentle stretches and have a guided meditation with the group. At the end we will share our experiences and open floor for questions and discussions. You can also ask any questions you may have in the beginning or email us now.

Please RSVP for the event and we look forward to seeing you.

This event is not sponsored by the Carnegie Library of Pittsburgh.

This meetup is cross-listed on I Meditate Pittsburgh at:
http://www.meetup.com/I-Meditate-Pittsburgh/events/227861177/

results.description:
Please RSVP on Bernie's site to be guarantee a seat https://go.berniesanders.com/page/event/detail/volunteeractivityormeeting/4ryr8


Come watch the 4th Democratic presidential debate with your good friends, Burghers for Bernie, as we commandeer the illustrious SPIRIT HALL in Lawrenceville, Pittsburgh. 

SPIRIT is known for its pizza and democratic, jovial atmosphere, SPIRIT HALL is the perfect venue for Pittsburgh’s Bernie base to convene and show the city how much SPIRIT we’ve got!

Join us before we watch the debates as we're going to go over easy tools you can use to help Bernie win the primaries! Help Bernie get that boost he needs by learning the most effective tools you can utilize to help him secure his victory! Learn how to phone bank, monitor phone banks, do data entry, mass text apps, and have access to members of Bernie's campaign team that can answer your questions!

We're going to give you the most effective tools– that has taken us months –to find and learn to use! If you want to help Bernie out, but you don't know how, this is why we're here! We want to help you get involved in the grass roots effort!

- Stop by the Progress n@ merchandise table to purchase t-shirts, limited edition buttons, bumper stickers, and other Bernie merchandise. (All proceeds go to supporting local Bernie-related events, not to the national campaign.) To donate directly to the national campaign, go to berniesanders.com.

- There will be a suggested donation of $5 at the door to help recoup the cost of the venue.

When: Sunday, January 17th. 8pm.

Where: Spirit Hall,[masked]st Street, Pittsburgh, PA 15201

results.description:
2 Rules for the meet up:

1) No solicitation of services *cool if someone comes to you but consultants/lawyers/coaches beware, any sales pitches and you'll have to find a new Monday ritual

2) Make sure to state whether what you are saying is an opinion or fact (both very much welcome) so to not confuse anyone about where the point of view comes from

Location change: Repair The World - 6022 Broad St. (Around the corner from Zeke's Coffee - grab your coffee from there and head over)

Share or listen to ideas but don't be fooled this is not startup therapy or feeding the ego this is about getting to work and removing the obstacles to make your idea a reality.

All entrepreneurs are welcome and it's not uncommon for us to have musicians, artists, chefs, writers, developers, renovators, or just about anyone else you can think of join the conversation.
results.name: Get your ideas or business UNSTUCK!

results.description:
Join us Mondays at 11:15am for a relaxing yoga class open to all levels. We'll focus on fundamental hatha yoga poses, some easy to moderate yoga flows, breathing techniques and relaxation. Gain a rich & nurturing experience of yoga. Beginner's are warmly welcomed!
We're a small, locally owned and family run studio with a peaceful, supportive, and inspiring atmosphere. We offer holistic classes with highly qualified teachers and a friendly group of regular students. It feels great to be part of a community doing something healthy for ourselves, and seeing others gaining the many benefits of yoga too!

If you are brand new to Sri Yantra Yoga Studio - come on in and try a class for Free (just mention this offer). Single classes are $14 ($12 for 65+ and students), or you can get a 3 month class package (6 classes for $70, or 10 for $100). You don't have to register in advance - just show up about 10 minutes early to get set up for class. Bring a mat or feel free to use one of ours. Hope to see you there!

More details about our studio, classes and teachers are available on our website  http://www.sriyantrayoga.com

results.description:
Special Interest Group:  Eastern European research. The objective of a SIG is for the participants to focus on learning about a specific topic related to their genealogical pursuits.  This group is being led by Karen Melis.

For more information please contact [masked]

JANUARY MEETING TOPIC:  Top ten genealogy goals for 2016 - The group wants its members to dsicuss specific or manageable tasks, so then the group can think about what skill or tool alternative search methods might help solve a piece of the puzzle.

NOVEMBER MEETING RECAP: the group members shared success stories from their own research. One member, whose grandfather had been interviewed for a book, wrote to the author to ask about additional notes from the author's interview with the grandfather... In return, the author provided her with copies of the tapes of the interview! Another member had success in finding a lost newspaper article on Google News Archive. She contacted the newspaper, who referred her to a library, who had copies of the article sent to her the next day. Other members discussed the graves of their ancestors in their villages in Europe, and paying for new gravestones.  


Agreed the meetings will be held at Northland Public Library, Boardroom (#103) from 6:30 to 8:30 pm.Cost: We are non-profit. We agreed that each week, each person will contribute $5.00 to cover the cost of the room rental ($25/meeting). Couples pay only $5.00. Karen will continue to pay for the room in advance via her credit card. If we have more than 5 people, the monies will still be collected and used for those nights with fewer than 5 people or to pay for a later meeting as funds accrue. An attendance record with the amount collected will be kept. 

Mission Statement:

The purpose of the EE- SIG is to help each other with our Eastern European genealogy. At our meetings we are among others who may have some guidance, similar experiences, and suggestions to help with our research. This can be in the form of identifying useful methodologies, websites, resources, etc. as well as trying to help break down some of our brick walls.The group agreed that an educational element may be interesting to do each meeting. For example, someone might pick a topic and present a short (no more than 15 minute) summary. Topics may include: Records that may hold clues to locating your ancestral village? What does the Naturalization Process consist of? What information can you glean from the US Census Records? We would like to rotate to those willing to present.A running list of useful websites / sources will be kept.Jen L provided a copy of useful Polish websites (see attached)Action: Karen will provide copies of “Tracing Your Eastern European Ancestors” from Family Chronicle
results.name: Eastern European Genealogy Interest Group

results.description:
Come and play ukulele with us at the Unitarian Universalist Church of the North Hills on the first and third Mondays of each month. All levels of play are welcome, and we are novice-friendly. Some people who come have never even held a ukulele, and if you contact Sandy ahead of time, she will bring an extra ukulele for you to try. Try it -- it's fun!

Music is usually selected from "The Daily Ukulele... 365 Songs for Better Living," by Liz and Jim Beloff. This book is readily available at music stores, book stores, and Amazon.com. Sometimes members bring other music to play (bring 15 copies to share). We play at a large conference table, so bring a table-top music stand if you have one.

Snacks and libations to share are welcome.

For more information, contact Sandy at [masked]

Directions to the Church: Take I279 North to Wexford exit. Turn right at the end of the exit. Right at the light onto Brandt School Road. Right onto West Ingomar Road to 2359. Note - watch for the large sign for the Church and then you will follow a narrow roadway back through the trees to the Church.

Depending on where you start, there may be a better route to the Church. Please check your GPS for different directions.

results.description:
This is one of our weekly sessions. Beginners' hour starts at 7:00 with instruction on basic footwork and formations, allowing everyone to participate in some fun social dances. From about 8:00 until 9:15, we have a Social Class - the focus is on more experienced dancers and complex dances, but beginners are encouraged to stay and watch, and participate in some of the simpler dances.


Beginners are always welcome, no partner necessary. (In fact, you will be encouraged to dance with more experienced dancers rather than with other beginners.)

The $7.00 fee per person for each class covers the cost of renting the room and paying the teacher. First-time attendees and dues-paying members pay only $5. We do not want price to be an obstacle for anyone attending class. Beginners have the option of purchasing a coupon booklet (good for 10 classes) for $30. Full-time students can always pay only $3 to attend. If these options don't work for you, please let me or one of the teachers know and other arrangements can be made.

Please don't be discouraged by the lack of RSVPs - many of our members do not belong to Meetup and so do not RSVP here. There will definitely be a crowd of dancers present!
results.how_to_find_us: Look for the red door in the lower level of the church on Sycamore St, and follow the sound of the music!

results.description:
Taking Action – Introducing Access Mob Pittsburgh
Alisa Grishman is starting Access Mob Pittsburgh. She says “The
Americans with Disabilities Act is a complaint-driven law that
requires individuals with disabilities to sue businesses in order to
be granted basic civil rights and gives the public a negative image of
people with visible differences. The goals of the Access Mob are to
bring communities together to advocate for change through positive
measures.”


Urban Design: How can complete streets policy make Pittsburgh more accessible?
Akshali Gandhi and Kristin Saunders from Pittsburgh’s Department of
City Planning
Sean Luther from Envision Downtown

Employment – What happens at the Office of Vocational Rehabilitation?
Catherine Getchell from the OVR


Please let us know anything we can do to make this event more
accessible and enjoyable for you. Contact Gabe McMorland with any
accessibility questions at [masked] or 412.719.3424. An
ASL interpreter will be present at the event and the library is
wheelchair accessible.
We’ll also have pizza for everyone. Please consider a making a
donation at the event to help cover the costs of food and
interpreters.

results.description:
Join us on Tuesdays for American Mah Jong! Folks begin arriving around 5PM, and play begins table by table as soon as we have three or four players plus a set.  (We usually have 3-5 tables.)  By 6:15 or so, most players have arrived. We rotate among the tables... at the end of each game, East walks around to see if another table is close to the end of their game, so that two players can swap places.   At the other end of the evening... play must end by 9PM when Panera closes.  Tables begin wrapping up play any time after 8:15 or so.


If you have never played, or if you have not played for a very long time, we highly recommend that you take a Mah Jong 101 beginner class before playing with us - beginner classes are offered every few months.  Mah jong is a wonderful game, but it's hard to learn by just watching others play!


Please order your 2015 card from the National Mah Jongg League, here: http://www.nationalmahjonggleague.org/ Amazon.com also carries the cards. Note that you want the NMJL card, and no other! (There are some colorful alternatives out there.. but we play NMJL card and rules.)

Experienced players -- please bring your cards and please bring a set if you have one.

Please do not bring any outside food or beverages into Panera! Instead, please plan to buy *something* from Panera, even if it's just a beverage or a cookie, to support their willingness to host us.
results.how_to_find_us: Hard to miss us, look for the Mah Jong sets!

results.description:
This is the intro and prerequisite class for all of our following classes. You must start on week 1. The Common Fencing class is usually limited to 12 -14 people per class. If you pay for your classes up-front you are guaranteed a seat on your day of choice. Additional sessions, walk-ins, and make-ups are subject to space in the class/permission from the instructor.
*Common drilling has a larger class size.

YOU MUST REGISTER AND PAY FOR THIS CLASS ON OUR WEBSITE.
Please read the info and follow the registration link at:
www.pittsburghswordfighters.com/brokenplow/classes/cfcd


Cost
The 8-week intro course is $100 (equal to two months of base membership). The base membership entitles you to the following: Access to all open floor sessions, access to all Common Fencing or Common Drilling classes, discounts on gear from our partner vendors (when ordered through our group orders), and access to all Broken Plow events (discount if there is a charge to attend).

You may also take classes for $15/class or open floor session. Once you complete Common Fencing you can substitute Rapier for the Common Drilling course or take both for a small up-charge. Other classes are being phased in during the spring of 2016.

The Tuesday classes are also held on Saturdays; however, the cycle weeks are staggered. You are welcome to attend class both days for no additional charge.

What to Wear & What to Bring
Please wear comfortable clothes. Workout clothes are highly recommended. Athletic shoes are a must and wrestling shoes are what many of our fighters wear.

We will provide the basic gear and the swords for this class. Loner gear is prioritized for the Common Fencing class over the Drilling class. We encourage people to begin getting basic gear once they have committed to more than three months. We can help you with this process and provide group discounts. Longsword Class Structure
Tuesday Timeline:
6:00pm - Open Floor & Tours
6:30pm - Group Warmup/PT
7:00pm - Breakout Classes (Common Fencing, Drilling, Etc)

Common Fencing is a class that is designed to introduce students to the basics of sword combat, footwork, terminology, and other fighting techniques. The CF class is an 8-week course that prepares you for the next class. Once you complete the 8-week course you may move on to the Common Drilling class. The drilling class is approximately 20 weeks of cycling drills, games, and slow sparring designed to teach/reinforce the fundamentals of German sword combat. Eventually students may move into higher level classes while still using the drilling class to practice and hone their skills.

Beginning in January we are adding a Rapier class; however, common fencing is required before you may begin other weapon classes.
results.name: Common Fencing - Week 1 (of 8)

results.description:
Please ask at the host stand for the book club. We are usually in the back room against the windows, but you never know...

For January, we chose Saving Grace by Jane Green, a classic chick-lit author.  

From Amazon:

Grace and Ted Chapman are widely regarded as the perfect literary power couple. Ted is a successful novelist and Grace, his wife of twenty years, is beautiful, stylish, carefree, and a wonderful homemaker. But what no one sees, what is churning under the surface, is Ted's rages. His mood swings. And the precarious house of cards that their lifestyle is built upon. When Ted's longtime assistant and mainstay leaves, the house of cards begins to crumble and Grace, with dark secrets in her past, is most vulnerable. She finds herself in need of help but with no one to turn to…until the perfect new assistant shows up out of the blue. To the rescue comes Beth, a competent young woman who can handle Ted and has the calm efficiency to weather the storms that threaten to engulf the Chapman household. Soon, though, it's clear to Grace that Beth might be too good to be true. This new interloper might be the biggest threat of all, one that could cost Grace her marriage, her reputation, and even her sanity. With everything at stake and no one to confide in, Grace must find a way to save herself before it is too late.

Powerful and riveting, Jane Green's Saving Grace will have you on the edge of your seat as you follow Grace on her harrowing journey to rock bottom and back.
results.why: We love to read, drink wine and talk about books!
results.how_to_find_us: Ask at the Host Stand for the Book Club
results.name: Shadyside Meeting - Saving Grace by Jane Green

group.name: The Pittsburgh Chick Lit Book Club

results.description:
Written by a Pitt English professor and filmed last year in Pittsburgh, how can we not discuss this one?

Read the book, see the movie-- do either one or neither. Open to all who want to talk about the concussion problem that threatens to derail the most profitable sports league in the world.

From Amazon:

Now a major motion picture starring Will Smith, Concussion is the riveting, unlikely story of Dr. Bennet Omalu, the pathologist who made one of the most significant medical discoveries of the twenty-first century, a discovery that challenges the existence of America’s favorite sport and puts Omalu in the crosshairs of football’s most powerful corporation: the NFL.

Jeanne Marie Laskas first met the young forensic pathologist Dr. Bennet Omalu in 2009, while reporting a story for GQ that would go on to inspire the movie Concussion. Omalu told her about a day in September 2002, when, in a dingy morgue in downtown Pittsburgh, he picked up a scalpel and made a discovery that would rattle America in ways he’d never intended. Omalu was new to America, chasing the dream, a deeply spiritual man escaping the wounds of civil war in Nigeria. The body on the slab in front of him belonged to a fifty-year-old named Mike Webster, aka “Iron Mike,” a Hall of Fame center for the Pittsburgh Steelers, one of the greatest ever to play the game. After retiring in 1990, Webster had suffered a dizzyingly steep decline. Toward the end of his life, he was living out of his van, tasering himself to relieve his chronic pain, and fixing his rotting teeth with Super Glue. How did this happen?, Omalu asked himself. How did a young man like Mike Webster end up like this? The search for answers would change Omalu’s life forever and put him in the crosshairs of one of the most powerful corporations in America: the National Football League. What Omalu discovered in Webster’s brain—proof that Iron Mike’s mental deterioration was no accident but a disease caused by blows to the head that could affect everyone playing the game—was the one truth the NFL wanted to ignore.
  Taut, gripping, and gorgeously told, Concussion is the stirring story of one unlikely man’s decision to stand up to a multibillion-dollar colossus, and to tell the world the truth.
results.name: Concussion by Jeanne Marie Laskas

results.description:
Presented by Embody Healing, LLC and Rebekah Gamble, HP.

Our monthly meetup allows people to do shamanic journey work together to have and share experiences, grow together, and have a sense of community with others engaged in their own spiritual growth and self healing. We request a $5 donation from those who can give to cover costs of the meetup, but you are more than welcome to come even if you are unable to donate. Each month we set an alter, welcome in the energies, share a journey, and release the energy. You are welcome to participate in the journey planned or to do your own journey work during the time we are journeying as a group. After the journey we have a quiet time for people to record their experiences if they choose to do so and then you are given an opportunity to share if you would like to (sharing is never required). You are recommended to have basic journey skills prior to the meetup as this is not a 101 class (I will be offering the next 101 class in January).

We're going to do this one a little bit differently. I will still set the space and we can build the alter and call in the directions and helpers as a group from 7-7:30. If you wish to be a part of this feel free to come in by 7. If you come in between 7-7:30, we ask that you wait in the lobby until we finish. Then at 7:30 we will begin the journey group proper. I am again going to diffuse appropriate oils for this meetup as it is still a bit dry for the smoke and we really enjoyed the oils last month. If you have an allergy or sensitivity, please let me know so I can plan accordingly.

This way those who can not come until later can still take part, and we can open the alter building to all involved.

The Aztec calendar for this date shows it's a good day for traveling and learning, so we're going to take the opportunity to travel to those who have helped us on the other side up to this point to get some guidance on what we should pay attention to in the upcoming year and see what else needs resolved in ourselves in order to be able to embrace that fully and live up to our fullest potentials in 2016. This is also during a thirteen day cycle where the energy encourages the transformation of poison into medicine. We intend for this gathering to be one which helps us to transform the energy of what is not helpful into energy which is.

Hope to see you there! Feel free to message me with questions or concerns at [masked]
results.name: Monthly Journey Meetup

results.description:
This is a traditional Hatha class taught with a vinyasa flow. We flow from one position to the next and focus on alignment, posture, breath, increased flexibility, strength, and balance. Class is held in the Keith Seminar Center upstairs at Dormont Library. It's private, has dimmer lights, carpet and we play music. I do the practice as I teach it. I tend to break a sweat and others do too, but it depends how much you put into it. The classes are usually 50/50 men and women. Lots of couples - couples, friends, sisters - attend. The class is donation-based. $5 donation is suggested.

All classes are from 7:00 – 8:00 pm.


Beginners are welcome.

$5 donation suggested.

Loaner mats available.

Visit: https://www.facebook.com/dormontyoga for more info. Hope to see you soon.
results.name: Yoga at the Library (Dormont, South Hills)

Bonjour aux avancés & lecteurs,

Il y a encore de la place au meetup littéraire ce soir.

Bring reading ideas or books you are currently reading.  I'll bring some things too.

à ce soir,

Marc Snyder

my contact info is under the PAGES section at the top of the French meetup.


Mise à jour (lundi le 18 janvier, 2016):  je propose nous réunir à Oakland sur Craig Street - rue proche de CMU et de Pitt et du Musée.  Enfin - puisque c'est la première réunion pour les 'littéraires', venez nombreux. Cet événement est gratuit et fait expressément pour les passionnés de la littérature française (comme yours truly).  


Apportez une liste de lectures qui vous intéressent.

Je souhaite que vous vous inscriviez sur le site meetup ici, mais venez même à l'improviste si ça vous chante.  Venez avec vos idées, vos suggestions de lecture, votre amour de la culture, votre engouement pour la lecture, votre désir d'échanger mots et idées.

Vous pouvez toujours me contacter par mes coordonnées - sur "pages" en haut de la page.

Vous pouvez toujours indiquez vos suggestions dans la discussion ci-dessous.

Le premier livre que j'aimerais aborder en groupe c'est le célèbre Voyage au bout de la nuit, par L.-F. Céline (1932) - disponible en pdf, poche, ou version kindle.

Le Union Grill est un pub très sympa et accueillant.  

À demain,

Marc Snyder


Un groupe pour les enthousiastes de culture et littérature française et francophone. This is a reading and culture group for serious fans of French literature, philosophy, and culture. If you read French literature and are looking for others to discuss it with, then this is the place for you. I have several degrees in French lit & civ and am always looking for people to share my interests with. Please comment under the meetup notes if you're interested and available dates and locations. I live in the North (Wexford) - but am willing to drive for good conversation (en français, bien sûr).

Last year was the year of Rousseau for me - I read/re-read most of his work. Previously re-read Proust for the 3rd time. Also interested in contemporary lettres, literature from the early part of the XXth century, Huysmans, Zola, classics, ANYTHING with substance. I know of one member who is trying to read Foucault. in the original, for example. Am open to ideas, suggestions, etc.

results.description:
All of us have a Dream Source within ourselves ready to provide us with timely news and information about our health, our careers, our relationships, the state of our psyche and possible futures before us. By claiming the energy of our dreams, working with the dreams and sharing them with other dreamers in a safe and encouraging space we can make great changes in our lives and find a source of creativity, fun and adventure within ourselves.


The foundation of becoming an awakened dreamer is dream journaling. We'll present basic journaling techniques and how to encourage our Dream Source to send us more dreams. One we have dreams to work with we can share them with others in a safe way that encourages us to take the positive energy of our dreams to make changes in our waking life. We will also cover using dreams as a source of creativity and problem solving, as a path to our own inner spiritual guides and as a fun place for exploration and adventure.


Once we become dreamers who are capturing and working with our dreams we can begin the real adventure. We are not limited to worldly concerns in dreaming and can use our dreams in near-infinite ways to expand our horizons and abilities and to have fun. We can use our dreams as the basis for creative works using the images directly or as the source for writing. We can play in our dream by dialoging with dream characters or performing dream theater in a group, or by reentering our dreams to get more information. The adventures you can have with dreaming are limitless and are only bounded by your imagination. 


Dreaming is an adventure, dreaming is fun, and dreaming is about soul. Join a group of fellow adventures who desire to dig into these ancient depths!
results.name: Let's Meetup and learn about dreams and share dreams!

results.description:
Join us for a 2-hour session of indoor volleyball open gym! You'll get a ton of playing time in a well-organized event. Our host will check players in, divide players into teams, and make sure that everything runs smoothly. All you have to do is show up ready to play!

Pricing:

• $7 - RSVP online and pay in advance (online rsvp closes at 4:30 pm!)

• $9 - RSVP and pay cash at the event

• $10 - Show up and play - be sure to check online to make sure there is room!

What to Wear: We are playing indoors on a rubberized all-sport surface. Most players wear volleyball-specific shoes, but gym shoes are also allowed. Please bring your shoes and change into them at the facility. This will help keep the floor clean of dirt and water.

What to Expect: Show up early! The games will begin at the time posted for this event. Players can start checking in with the event host as early as 15 minutes before the scheduled start time. If a court is available, you may begin warming up before the event begins. We limit play to 42 players per evening, which is 3 teams of 7 players per court. If we have 3 teams on a court, winners stay once and then shuffle out so everyone gets to play. If less people are in attendance, we divide based on who is there and mix things up half way through the session.

Level of Play: This event is open to all levels of play. We do our best to create even teams so that games are well-matched. Our ideal scenario is having one court of higher skilled players and one court of more recreational players. There are no referees, so players need to play with sportsmanship and make their own calls. We aim to make everyone feel welcome at these events.

Facility Information: Monroeville Sports Center is located at 855 Macbeth Drive in Monroeville. Parking should be ample in the free lot.

Minimum number of players and playing formats. This event needs a minimum of 12 people (not including the host) signed up before the start of the event in order to run. An email notification will be sent if we cancel. Refunds or credits will be issued if we cancel the event. Sign up early to encourage more people to sign up!!

Do Your Part! Help us keep an accurate guest count! If you RSVP, we're counting on you to be there. If you change your mind about playing or your guest count changes, please update your RSVP. No-Shows will be marked on your account. If space is tight, we hold RSVP spots 10 minutes into advertised start and then open spots to walk-ups.

Requirements to play: This is an adult volleyball group. You must be 19 older. Males and females of all skill levels are welcome to play. There is no required gender ratio. Players are expected to conduct themselves with good sportsmanship.

What's included in the price? Your payment helps to cover the rental costs, the hourly pay for your event host, and ensures a well-organized event.

Questions? Post your question in the comments section of this meetup and the event host or one of our organizers will reply. You can also message the organizers directly through meetup. Or, give us a call M-F 8:00am-12:30pm:[masked]-7130.

results.description: The "Incito Veritas" founding fathers (which included females, of course, as no soul has a gender) originally called this group "Fight Club" and first intended to keep that name while maintaining secrecy. So much for that. But the spirit of Fight Club remains, the idea of trying to bring out the best in each other through the evolution of consciousness. As Brad Pitt said about the movie, "Fight Club is a metaphor for the need to push through the walls we put around ourselves and just go for it." And not fear the pain! In this meetup we discuss ways that concepts introduced during the Incito Veritas series can be applied to our daily lives. We will learn and grow as we process our experiences. Bottom line: Knowing and Not Doing is Not Knowing, or as it says in James 2:26, "For as the body without the spirit is dead, so faith without works is dead."

Important Event Announcement


Andrea Putnam the national campaign's Director of Ballot Access and Delegate Selection, will be in town on Wednesday 1/20 with her staff to give a training event on how to circulateballot access petitions.


These are for both Bernie and for each of the delegates in a Congressional District. Without the petitions in adequate numbers, neither Bernie nor the selected delegates willbe on the ballot in AprilWhile this is going on, it is obviously very important!


The training will be at the East Liberty branch of Carnegie Library of Pittsburgh, 130 S. WhitfieldSt. in rooms 3A&3B from 6:30 to 7:30PM.


The event is called "Ballot Access Petition"  --- to comply with library policy.  So please don't askwhere the Bernie event is!  Or bring Bernie posters with you or proclaim "feel the bern!" We will have people there to point you in the right direction.

RSVP

1st and 3rd Wednesday evenings of each month. Winter locale is Wilkins School Community Center, 7604 Charleston Ave., Regent Square, PA 15218. Summer locale is Biddle's Escape, 401 Biddle Ave., Regent Square, PA 15221.

Yellow book: He's Got the Whole World in His Hands (107); Clementine (51); O Susanna (178);  I Walk the Line (138);  Let It Be Me (147);  Paper Moon (133); Makin' Whoopie (157)

Blue Book:  Let's Get Away From it All (221);  Old Cape Cod (270);  Sweet Georgia Brown (334);  Moonglow (251)

Uke, a tuner, a music stand

results.description:
It's our first meetup of 2016 and we're reading The Undomestic Goddess by Sophie Kinsella.

Workaholic attorney Samantha Sweeting has just done the unthinkable. She’s made a mistake so huge, it’ll wreck any chance of a partnership. 

Going into utter meltdown, she walks out of her London office, gets on a train, and ends up in the middle of nowhere. Asking for directions at a big, beautiful house, she’s mistaken for an interviewee and finds herself being offered a job as housekeeper. Her employers have no idea they’ve hired a lawyer–and Samantha has no idea how to work the oven. She can’t sew on a button, bake a potato, or get the #@%# ironing board to open. How she takes a deep breath and begins to cope–and finds love–is a story as delicious as the bread she learns to bake. 

But will her old life ever catch up with her? And if it does…will she want it back?


If you have book suggestions for February, make sure you bring them!  Not sure what type of books we read?  We decided our version of chick lit is anything that has a strong female main character.

results.description:
ONE WEEK ONLY! And if you signed up for league play on Wednesdays, be sure to RSVP and we will mark you PAID FREE for this event. As long as you pay for league play on/by 4:30 this Wednesday and rsvp here, you can come out FREE.

Join us for a 2-hour session of indoor volleyball open gym! You'll get a ton of playing time in a well-organized event. Our host will check players in, divide players into teams, and make sure that everything runs smoothly. All you have to do is show up ready to play!

Pricing:

• $7 - RSVP online and pay in advance (online rsvp closes at 4:30 pm!)

• $9 - RSVP and pay cash at the event

• $10 - Show up and play - be sure to check online to make sure there is room!

What to Wear: We are playing indoors on a rubberized all-sport surface. Most players wear volleyball-specific shoes, but gym shoes are also allowed. Please bring your shoes and change into them at the facility. This will help keep the floor clean of dirt and water.

What to Expect: Show up early! The games will begin at the time posted for this event. Players can start checking in with the event host as early as 15 minutes before the scheduled start time. If a court is available, you may begin warming up before the event begins. We limit play to 42 players per evening, which is 3 teams of 7 players per court. If we have 3 teams on a court, winners stay once and then shuffle out so everyone gets to play. If less people are in attendance, we divide based on who is there and mix things up half way through the session.

Level of Play: This event is open to all levels of play. We do our best to create even teams so that games are well-matched. Our ideal scenario is having one court of higher skilled players and one court of more recreational players. There are no referees, so players need to play with sportsmanship and make their own calls. We aim to make everyone feel welcome at these events.

Facility Information: Monroeville Sports Center is located at 855 Macbeth Drive in Monroeville. Parking should be ample in the free lot.

Minimum number of players and playing formats. This event needs a minimum of 12 people (not including the host) signed up before the start of the event in order to run. An email notification will be sent if we cancel. Refunds or credits will be issued if we cancel the event. Sign up early to encourage more people to sign up!!

Do Your Part! Help us keep an accurate guest count! If you RSVP, we're counting on you to be there. If you change your mind about playing or your guest count changes, please update your RSVP. No-Shows will be marked on your account. If space is tight, we hold RSVP spots 10 minutes into advertised start and then open spots to walk-ups.

Requirements to play: This is an adult volleyball group. You must be 19 older. Males and females of all skill levels are welcome to play. There is no required gender ratio. Players are expected to conduct themselves with good sportsmanship.

What's included in the price? Your payment helps to cover the rental costs, the hourly pay for your event host, and ensures a well-organized event.

Questions? Post your question in the comments section of this meetup and the event host or one of our organizers will reply. You can also message the organizers directly through meetup. Or, give us a call M-F 8:00am-12:30pm:[masked]-7130.

$8 
A screenie pass gets you 12 films (and a free popcorn or soda!) for only $80: http://cinema.pfpca.org/screenie-subscription 

On this years Oscar shortlist for Best Documentary Feature

"Hello, little bonehead. I'll love you forever." So begins Heart of a Dog, creative pioneer Laurie Anderson's wry, wondrous, and unforgettable cinematic journey through love, death, and language. Anderson’s powerful personal essay reflects on the deaths of her husband Lou Reed, her mother, and her beloved dog through larger ruminations of the afterlife, post-9/11 anxieties, and existentialism. This inventive amalgamation of animation, visual effects, 8mm home-movie clips, newly shot footage, and variously doctored or distressed images combine with Anderson’s philosophical, voice-over narration and signature soundtrack as both a demonstration and a critique of the art of storytelling.

Laurie Anderson | USA | 2015 | 75 min.

Trailer:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HnKVjZfKhYs
results.name: Heart of a Dog by Laurie Anderson @ Harris Theater

results.description:
This is the  1st actual lesson for this group. Last week, we established the level and  time and day of the lessons.

This week we will start with  a mini conversation based on the Lebanese Mini dialogues sent by PDF and Quizlets A!, A2 A4  greetings, classroom vocab and colors. We will then go over the non connector letters and the corresponding sight words. Students will take turns writing words, reading them and saying their meanings. Students will challenge eachothers this way.

We will close by introducing the new group of letters and sight words. then assigning homework.

This system is based on the FLipped classroom concept where students prepare for the material ahead of time and use what they have learned in the classroom.

See you on Wednesday.

Roula

results.description:
You are warmly invited to partake in a mindful movement practice fusing breath, body, spirit, and story! Our hour together will be full of free-form movement set to a totally awesome playlist ;) 

This "Dancing Mindfulness" version of our regular Thursday Sacred Grooves gathering will invite attitudes of mindfulness, such as nonjudgment, beginner's mind, and acceptance, into your physical experience of body, space, and movement. Dancing Mindfulness is a trauma-informed movement practice, developed by Dr. Jamie Marich. You can learn more on her website: http://www.dancingmindfulness.com/

As always, Come as your Are and Move as you Wish ~ No dancing experience required; No steps to learn. 

Suggested donation at the door ~ Give what you wish as your presence is worth much more than your money :)

I look forward to dancing with you!
results.name: Dancing Mindfulness

results.description:
Get Heard! Get Noticed! Get Leads! (TM)


This event is hosted by Tammy Adkins with RAIN International and co hosted by Kobbie Alamo, Independent Consultant for Arbonne.

This is an informal networking event, open to any business woman who would like to increase her business contacts or clients in the Irwin area.

Things to bring:

- 10-20 business cards or marketing material

- cash for your lunch check

- $5 meeting fee (non members only)

AGENDA

1:00 pm - attendees arrive, reviews menu, gives the server their drink order, and open networking: everyone stands up to introduce oneself to others and pass their business card

1:15 pm - server takes lunch order and the sign in sheet is passed around

1:30 pm - 60 sec. commercials begin

2:00 pm - each person gives a testimony or referral for someone attending the lunch

2:30 pm - Premier member does a 5 min. company presentation

2:35 pm - WSBA announcements from Debi/Susan

2:45 pm - lunch has ended. Open networking is welcomed.

Be prepared to do a 60 second commercial about yourself. Please RSVP if you plan to attend this lunch. If your schedule becomes free the day of the lunch, then you may attend without an RSVP. This lunch is subject to cancellation when the lunch has 3 or less RSVPs. Lunch cancellation policy.

If you are not a WSBA member and would like to attend as a guest, please contact Kimberly Smith - kimfitnesschic at gmail.com

If you have an interest in becoming a General member ($50/year) or Premier member ($100/year) of WSBA, please contact Debi Arnett - debadastra at yahoo.com

Any non member will be subject for removal from this site, when they RSVP that they are attend, and they are a no show.

results.description:
UPDATE: WOMEN SOLD OUT!!!

Don't Miss Out On Pittsburgh's Most Exciting New Dating Concept...Play Dating


If you're a single professional between the ages of 25 - 45 you don’t want to miss this!

15 dates in 1 night, unlike anything you’ve ever experienced before.

NO awkward conversations with a stranger across a table.

NO scrambling to come up with interesting things to talk about.

Only fun and genuine connections with great people.

P.S. It's okay if you're a few years outside of this range, please feel free to attend.

Tickets:

$15 prepay

Purchase Prepay tickets here: http://www.danitawalton.com/events/play-dating/pittsburgh-25-45/

</a>

<a href="http://www.danitawalton.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/a242f8c372d436c89af82fb5349423be.jpg">

This spontaneous event is a combination of Game Night and Speed Dating. Join other fun and friendly singles for a casual and comfortable party like no other!

Here is how it works…

~ Upon arrival you will be greeted by the friendliest host you’ve ever met and given a name tag with a random number, as well as a sheet to keep track of everyone you meet

~ Time to Play: every 6 minutes you will receive a mystery message with a secret task to carry out with your 6 minute date

~ At the end of the night let us know the people you would like to see again. ~ If the feeling’s mutual, we will exchange your contact information.

</a>

<a href="http://www.danitawalton.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/34082e76b0c822af_shutterstock_107906033.xxxlarge_2x.jpg">

Common Questions:

What if I don’t have a match?

Even if you don’t have a match, we’ll give you the the contact information for those who are interested in you. You never know what might happen!

Can I come alone?

Yes 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.

What are the age ranges?

This event will cater mostly to single professionals in their 20s, 30s, and 40s however we have events for all kinds of demographics. Check out our Meetup Group Relationship Ready Singles - Pittsburgh for more coming events (http://www.meetup.com/relationship-ready-singles-burgh/)

How is this different from other speed dating events?

The brainchild of matchmaker, Danita Walton, Play Dating is a unique dating concept centered around the premise of spontaneity, fun, and connection.

Should you meet your Mr. or Mrs. right we want you to be able to tell the story as if we were never there. So forget about meeting someone and just come out and have some fun!

Purchase Prepay tickets here: http://www.danitawalton.com/events/play-dating/pittsburgh-25-45/
results.name: SOLD OUT!!! Singles & Sushi @ Nakama - Play Dating, Speed Dating

results.description:
Well hello there!

First order a business... A special thanks to everyone who brought toys for our Toys for Tots donation box. Additionally, some of you made a donation to the Brashear Foundation Toy Drive. Total donations for that drive totaled over $2,000! These donations were greatly appreciated and will help many kids in need have a wonderful Christmas. Again, thanks for your warm-hearted generosity.    

We are all set for our next Meetup, which will be Thursday January 21st at Christina's in White Oak - 6:30Pm Arrival 7Pm Start. Our guest speaker will be Eve Picker.

Eve Picker, a pioneer in urban development in Pittsburgh, is now the president and co-founder of Small Change, a real estate equity crowdfunding platform focusing on transformational real estate projects. For more detailed information on this new company here's a link:

http://www.nextpittsburgh.com/business-tech-news/small-changes-offers-crowdsourced-investment-for-transformational-real-estate/

Eve Picker also did a project in the Garfield section of Pittsburgh called the Tiny House Project. You can read more details about that special development here:

http://triblive.com/news/allegheny/8555456-74/tiny-garfield-citylab#ixzz3d8pA1QW5

There has been TONS of exciting new developments regarding crowdfunding, raising private capital, etc. Bring your notebook and your questions. We expect this to be a very informative get-together!

Looking forward to growth and prosperity in 2016!

Jerry & Pam - Organizers

C (412)[masked]

A few photos of our December Meetup with Joe Calloway...

results.description:
According to the WordPress Codex the WordPress loop is:

The Loop is PHP code used by WordPress to display posts. Using The Loop, WordPress processes each post to be displayed on the current page, and formats it according to how it matches specified criteria within The Loop tags. Any HTML or PHPcode in the Loop will be processed on each post.


If this description leaves you confused, or you just want to learn more (or just want to hang out with other WordPress folks), join us for Phil Webster's talk on the WordPress Loop!

Parking in front of TechShop is limited to one hour. Please park in the Bakery Square Garage. Parking is free for up to 3 Hours.

results.description:
The Internet has become an integral part of everyday lives. Engineers develop and test software and systems designed for the Internet everyday. But how many of us understand what the Internet is, where it came from and where its going ? This talk will provide a detailed overview of Internet Architecture and Design and some of the technical and business issues surrounding the design and development of the Internet. It will also provide key tools and skills that all Engineers can use to make development of Internet connected software and systems easier.

André Henry will be presenting. André has over 15 years experience in the Technology Industry. He has spent time as a Software Engineer, Network Engineer and a Systems Engineer. He currently works for Think Through Learning.
results.name: How to Build the Internet

results.description: The "Incito Veritas" founding fathers (which included females, of course, as no soul has a gender) originally called this group "Fight Club" and first intended to keep that name while maintaining secrecy. So much for that. But the spirit of Fight Club remains, the idea of trying to bring out the best in each other through the evolution of consciousness. As Brad Pitt said about the movie, "Fight Club is a metaphor for the need to push through the walls we put around ourselves and just go for it." And not fear the pain! In this meetup we discuss ways that concepts introduced during the Incito Veritas series can be applied to our daily lives. We will learn and grow as we process our experiences. Bottom line: Knowing and Not Doing is Not Knowing, or as it says in James 2:26, "For as the body without the spirit is dead, so faith without works is dead."
results.name: Fight Club: Ready ... Set ... Action!

results.description:
Hello everyone!

If you are reading this you probably at least have a passing interest in this new modern board gaming fad. 

If you are under the impression that we play games like Monopoly, Risk, Clue, and Candyland you are in for a rude awakening.

Modern board gaming is experiencing growth like crazy!  Not only with the number of people playing games but also with the number of new releases every year.  Can you believe there were over 700 new games released last year and that number is expected to rise even more this year. 

Even relatively new modern board games that you might have heard of like Settlers of Catan is now over twenty years old and another modern classic Ticket to Ride is over ten.  We still play and enjoy the older modern games but it is primarily because the companies keep them fresh by offering expansions to the regular content.  When was the last time you saw a content update to Monopoly or Risk?

Today's board games come in all different shapes, sizes, themes, components, and our group plays all kinds.. Here are some examples of the types of games we play...

Party games like:  Codenames, Spyfall, and Dixit.

Euro style games like:  Five Tribes, Orleans, Puerto Rico, Viticulture, and Lords of Waterdeep. 

Abstract games like:  Qwirkle, Blokus, and Hive

Card games like:  Dominion, Glory to Rome, Diamonds, and Munchkin

Those are just a few of the games that can be seen being played at our meetups every week.

Our members come in all shapes and sizes and span from young to older but all seem to have a great time when we get together!

Our organizers try to be very accommodating to new players and try to pick games appropriate to your skill level and that we think you would enjoy.  Our goal is to get you enthusiastic about the hobby.

If there is a game that you would like to try out just r.s.v.p. to one of our meetups and suggest it down in the chat.  Chances are that one of us has it in our collection and we can bring it out.

Look forward to introducing the hobby to many more players in 2016 and continued good times with our regulars.

Please r.s.v.p. early so I have an idea on how many people or coming and what games to bring along.  You can always cancel your r.s.v.p. if you have a change of plans.


See you soon!

Russ.

You're Invited!

Join us for our next dinner party/social outing for gay singles in the Pittsburgh area (couples looking to make new friends are always welcome too). This is a great way to start the New Year and meet others in the LGBT community who are also looking for some new friends, connections, & relationships, just like you.  We typically have over 40 in attendance, so it's always a good-sized group. It's an ideal way to expand your social circle and have a great time too.  

This month we're meeting at Hough's Taproom, which is a casual brewpub located in the heart of the Greenfield neighborhood.  They have a great variety of brews for the beer connoisseur as well.  Total cost is $30 and includes buffet with salad, 2 sides, roast beef & chicken, tea & coffee, dessert, cost of private room for socializing, and tax & tip.  Our events are very easygoing & casual and this is the perfect opportunity to meet lots of new people.  We always have fun! results.description:
Below is an image of the goddess Brigid whom we honor at Imbolc. Imbolc also celebrates the very first awakenings of spring. Yes, we know that, for us, spring is not so close on January 22nd; but certainly, spring will be in our hearts in the place provided for wishes and yearnings.

In Ireland, Brigid's name is pronounced Breej. There are as many names for her as their were cultures that held her dear. She is the protective goddess, the protector of the home and all who live there. In the illustration below, you'll see Brigid's cross by her womb. This a a pre-Christian symbol, a protective amulet/talisman that will  bring us what we most desire in our lives at this time.


We will meditate and create our own Brigid's crosses. Come and learn about Brigid and her traditions. Oh, and you don't have to be Irish to take away a wonderful feeling.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be in the Senior High room on the lower level.
results.name: Join us for the ancient Celtic celebration of Imbolc

results.description:
Only a little over an hour outside of Pittsburgh. It's a 2 day event featuring 50 amazing ice sculptures in the beautiful Laurel Highlands.

Obviously because it's January, I'm sure most members will wait to see what the weather will be like.  I wanted to post now so you could mark your calendars.

If you don't make this one, you might want to consider the the Ice Festival in Franklin, PA in February. (I will post that as well) it's almost the same distance as Ligonier. 

Ligonier Ice Fest!

 It's Ice Fest's 25th Anniversary! Grab a warm drink and enjoy the ice masterpieces around town! The Ligonier Ice Fest features more than 50 ice sculptures, carved while you watch! Plus, kettle korn, and horse-drawn sleigh rides (weather permitting) and live music both days. The Speed Carving event will be held on the Diamond, Sunday at 2 p.m.

Don't miss the Fireman's Famous Spaghetti Dinner on Saturday, starting at 11 a.m.! 

Times:

10 a.m.-4 p.m., Saturday, January 23
12-4 p.m., Sunday, January 24

As spring arrives, we will have official meet ups!  In the winter it's just so hard to commit to anything, not knowing what the weather will be like.     I hope a few of us will make this.   The ice sculptures look AMAZING!  

Check out some of the images from the past, google:

ligonier ice sculpture images

I'm not sure because I've never photographed ice before but It seems like it could be a little challenging.   :)

results.description:
East End Food Co-op is pleased to present Winterfest once again this year! Our annual, seasonal celebration and fundraiser for the Greater Pittsburgh Community Food Bank will take place on Saturday, January 23, 2016 at the Hosanna House in Wilkinsburg from 1 PM to 5 PM. The event will feature food, music, and fun for all ages!

The menu will include light fare with vegetarian and vegan items from the Co-op Café, as well appetizers and snacks donated by vendors and other local partners. There will be an array of sweet treats for everyone, including cookies and goodies from the Co-op’s Bulk Department. Adults age 21 and over can buy a wristband for $5 that gives them access to the open bar, which will include wine and a number of locally-brewed craft beers provided by the East End Brewing Company.

Attendees can also participate in a Chance Auction with prizes donated by local businesses, community partners, and arts organizations!

Each attendee will receive one free raffle ticket. Additional tickets can be purchased ($2 for 1 ticket, $5 for 3 tickets, $10 for 10 tickets, $20 for 25 tickets), and all proceeds benefit the Greater Pittsburgh Community Food Bank.

All food, non-alcoholic drinks, activities, plus one complimentary raffle ticket are included in the entry price. The cost to attend is $7 for Co-op adult members (who must present their Co-op membership card at the door); $10 for adult non-members; $3 for ages 5-18 (member or non-member), and children under 5 are free. An additional fee of $5 will be charged to any adults over the age of 21 who wish to consume alcohol and ID will be required.
results.name: East End Food Co-op's Winterfest

results.description:
At the November meeting Members discussed their aspirations and expectations for this new SIG. Most feel they have enough material to begin writing, but don't always know where to start. The group discussed some issues faced: needing direction as to what to include, how to start, how to organize and verify materials, how to use computer-based software to make the process easier, etc.

Assignments proposed for the January meeting were to A) Pick an ancestor and write a few paragraphs or pages of this person, using a timeline and citing each source or B) Interview a relative during the holiday season, showing them old photos, heirlooms, etc., and write up the interview as a narrative.


This Interest Group will meet in members' homes. It is suggested that members bring their laptops to meetings.  The January meeting will be be at the home of Diane and David George.  Please email [masked] for details on the meeting location.

results.description:
You are invited to the second Raw Cacao Party! The first party was such a success that we felt the momentum carrying us into doing one of these every month. We're so excited to share the healing vibrations of raw cacao and the love in our hearts with you!!
Life is light and life is love! Raw cacao is one of many amazing plants that the earth provides for us to heal in this time when we so desperately need the help.
The Raw Cacao party is designed to be educational, inspirational, transformative, entertaining and deeply connective. Our intention is for Empowerment through Self-love and Self-care. It's an immersive, transformative, and deeply healing and fun experience that everyone would love. If you love chocolate, you will LOVE raw chocolate ;) Who knew healthy could be so delicious? Invite your friends!
Learn recipes for raw chocolate, have fun, and connect deeply with new and old friends! We'll be doing free-form yoga and dance and playing authentic relating games to help us open up and let our love flow.
The party is on January the 23rd, at 5pm till 9 pm.
The cost of the event is $15 online and $20 at the door. Here you can purchase online tickets: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/raw-cacao-party-tickets-20094189261
Funds go to the continual development of the Schwartz Living Market and the time of the organizer. Thank you so much!

Love you all, and we can't wait to see you there. ♥ ♥ ♥
results.name: Raw Cacao Party!

results.description:
Click Here


Hiking or snowshoeing through a winter landscape illuminated by the full moon is an experience you won't want to miss. Join L.L.Bean Pittsburgh as we take a hike or snowshoe the trails of North Park – Allegheny County Parks' largest park that features over 40 miles of multiuse trails. Please make sure you wear appropriate hiking clothing, waterproof footwear (if possible) and dress for the weather (layers; no cotton.) Please bring snowshoeing equipment if the weather requires it. Please bring a small day pack with extra clothes, snacks, water and any personal medications you may need. Ages 8 and up are welcome. Hope to see you on the trail!


Thank you for your interest in our free "Snowshoe or Hike Outing." L.L.Bean has a centralized reservation system. To guarantee your space, you must first confirm your reservation on our new centralized reservation system, and if appropriate, fill out a participant agreement. Please visit www.llbean.com/pittsburgh, find this event on the "Event Calendar", and register. We look forward to seeing you!

Activity Level:
Physical Ability/Cardiovascular Demand: Easy
Level of Experience: Intro

Hike distance will be about 4 miles

What to bring:
Snowshoe equipment
Dress in Layers (avoid Cotton)
Sturdy Hiking Boots
Two Light Sources: Headlamp, Flashlight, Extra Flashlight, etc.
Water to stay hydrated 
Snacks 
Completed and signed L.L.Bean participant agreement Click Here


Additional: Lip Balm, Camera, Change of Shoes, Dry Bag, Walking Stick or Trekking Poles, Personal Medicines, Eye Protection

Minimum Age 8: This outing is open to ages 8 and above. Children 8 to 14 years of age need to be accompanied by a participating adult. Children 15 to 17 years old can participate alone after their parent has signed the L.L.Bean participant agreement for minors. 

Need help preparing for your next adventure? Visit L.L.Bean Store at Ross Park Mall and ask to speak with an Outdoor Product Specialist. L.L.Bean will fit you with the right clothing and gear for all of life's adventures.

L.L.Bean Store at Ross Park Mall 
1000 Ross Park Mall Drive (Map) 
Pittsburgh, PA  15237 
L.L.Bean Outdoor Discovery Schools 
Website | Meetup | Twitter | Facebook
results.how_to_find_us: In the parking lot
results.name: Full Wolf Moon Snowshoe or Hike in North Park

results.description:
Its that time of year ... shorter days ... schools in full swing ... and well, we all want to keep skating!

For those who haven't skated the off season with us before, these are slightly less organized, unpatrolled skated.    What that means is distance and terrain varies.   Most likely there will be a hill or two ... maybe three.    And distance is usually 15-20 miles over about two to two and half hours.    We'll still be looking out for the last skater and regrouping periodically, and including an optional coffee stop mid to end of the skating.       We'll continue, weather permitting (roads dry) straight through 'til spring!

A SPECIAL ACCOMMODATION IS BEING EXTENDED TO OUR GROUP BY THE RESTAURANT SO I AM OPENING THIS UP TO 10 PEOPLE. PLEASE ADVISE IF YOU HAVE A CHANGE IN PLANS AS A WAIT LIST IS FORMING. -LS

Every once in a while you stumble on to a place that is more of an experience than 'just brunch.' Here you have it! This place not only provides brunch with a buffet at a reasonable price but also provides a fun ambiance. This is a vegetarian restaurant (eggs and cheese are served) and antique shop.


Clarification per my chat with Cafe Zenith:

"Everything we make is prepared vegan you have the option of cheese on occasion on entree items. the new menu is not posted because I build the menu on what I find in the strip and from my purveyers but i will be happy to post the menu on this thread when i get it."

Here's the current menu:

ZENITH BRUNCH MENU $11.50 INCLUDES COFFEE OR HOT OR COLD TEA & BUFFET (SORRY NO TO GO BOXES)

SCRAMBLED (ACTUAL) EGGS WITH ROMANO CHEESE

VEGAN STRAWBERRY FRENCH TOAST WITH BANANA TOPPING

VEGAN HAZELNUT PANCAKES WITH BANANA TOPPING

VEGAN BARBEQUE BLACK BEAN BURGER WITH GRILLED ONIONS

VEGAN SEITAN MEATLOAF WITH MASHED POTATOES & GRAVY

VEGAN & GLUTEN FREE TUNISIAN BEANS AND GREENS (CHICKPEAS, KALE, SPINACH, TOMATOES & ONIONS OVER RICE)

BLACK ICED TEA / HERBAL HOT TEA APRICOT SPICE

The price of brunch is a mere $11.50 and includes coffee/ tea. 

No reservations are a accepted here so I will be there to stand in line and secure a table for 8 at 10:30AM even though they open for business at 11:00. IF YOU ARE NOT THERE BY THE TIME I AM ASKED IF ALL OF THE PARTY TO BE SEATED IS PRESENT, YOU, WILL UNFORTUNATELY BE UNABLE TO JOIN US. Sorry, but otherwise we would lose the table. Their policy! I do have to limit it to 8 due to the size of the dining area.
results.name: BRUNCH AT CAFE ZENITH

results.description:
Please sign up if you're planning on playing and bring your favorite games!  Newbies are very welcome.  We have some great teachers to help you get started on your gaming adventure.  Let us know when you sign up what game(s) you'll be bringing.  On Sundays there is plenty of free parking on the side streets and even right on Murray.  Crazy Mocha serves great coffee, specialty drinks, snacks and pastries.  They do allow us to bring food in if we take our trash with us. We usually play all day, break for dinner around 6:00, then it's back to gaming until everybody poops out. 

Incidentally, many of our regular players no longer bother to sign up (but I really wish they would!), so if it looks like only  one or two people are coming, there could actually be quite a few more.  Remember, I will always cancel a game Meetup if we aren't gaming that day, so you won't be sitting there all by yourself waiting for a friend.    And please, remember to change your rsvp to no if you can't make it that day!

$1.00 will be charged to help cover the fee Meetup charges and to buy games for the group.  Join us and let the games begin!!!
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be the ones playing games.
results.name: Play Eurogames!

results.name: Japanese Study Group level 2

results.description:
We will be using "Japanese for Busy People" book 2 version 3.   As usual, we'll meet in Classroom C.


This is a combination of "Beginner 2" and Intermediate 1" levels from last year.


Let's try to figure out how we can improve upon what we are learning so that we can make it both more interactive and at the same time begin to really use our language skills.  Do we want to try having more quizzes?  Interactive dialog?  Roleplaying?

The text book for this class is An integrated approach to inter.mediate Japanese.

2 Rules for the meet up:

1) No solicitation of services *cool if someone comes to you but consultants/lawyers/coaches beware, any sales pitches and you'll have to find a new Monday ritual

2) Make sure to state whether what you are saying is an opinion or fact (both very much welcome) so to not confuse anyone about where the point of view comes from

Location change: Repair The World - 6022 Broad St. (Around the corner from Zeke's Coffee - grab your coffee from there and head over)

Share or listen to ideas but don't be fooled this is not startup therapy or feeding the ego this is about getting to work and removing the obstacles to make your idea a reality.

All entrepreneurs are welcome and it's not uncommon for us to have musicians, artists, chefs, writers, developers, renovators, or just about anyone else you can think of join the conversation.

Entrepreneurs helping each other. Bring your ideas, questions and experiences. Providing face-to-face help and feedback for your business in bite-sized chunks.

This meetup is right after the Unstuck Entrepreneur Meetup http://www.meetup.com/unstuckmondaymeetup/ which is right there at Repair the World from 8-9AM. Think about coming to BOTH!


After meeting outside in the lobby of Repair the World / Alpha Lab Gear / Thrill Mill, we adjourn upstairs to Alpha Lab Gear.

This meetup is run by an experienced entrepreneur who started a business, ran it for over 20 years and successfully exited to a public company. He now keeps busy mentoring for a nationally recognized accelerator, reviewing business plans/pitches for investors and consulting for businesses & non-profits. When asked “why do a meetup?” he says he is looking to “pay it forward” by helping people make less mistakes than he made.

results.description:
How to protect yourself from your computer taking you RANSOM.

'Ransomware' is a type of malware that attempts to extort money from a computer user by infecting and taking control of the victim's machine, or the files or documents stored on it. • Typically, the ransomware will either 'lock' the computer to prevent normal usage, or encrypt the documents and files on it to prevent access to the saved data. Join us to find out how to protect yourself from this type of malware. 

Stan Hoffman will lead the presentation and we will have members of the Geek Squad helping as the experts at this meeting.

Hope to see you there!
results.name: AITP January Meetup - Protect yourself from your computer taking you RANSOM!

results.description: There are four levels of understanding: 1. Thinking, 2. Believing, 3. Knowing, 4. Being. In the centuries after Jesus walked the earth, Christianity diverged down two distinctly differently pathways between "believing" and "knowing." Those who "believe" that they can come to "know" God by "being" God are known as Gnostics. This group examines Gnostic concepts and looks closely at the soul-stirring teachings of Jesus in the Gospel of Thomas. Understand this text by reading in the language of spirit and indeed you will have no doubt about your purpose on earth. Jesus even says so in the first verse of Thomas!

Monday, January 25, 2016 | 6:30pm | Kresge Theatre (map)
eva_franch.jpg
EVA FRANCH i GILABERT is a New York-based architect, curator, educator, and lecturer of experimental forms of art and architectural practice. Since 2010, Franch is the Chief Curator and Executive Director of Storefront for Art and Architecture in New York. In 2014 Franch, with the project OfficeUS, was selected by the US State Department to represent the United States Pavilion at the XIV Venice Architecture Biennale. Franch has taught at Columbia University GSAPP, the IUAV University of Venice, SUNY Buffalo, and Rice University School of Architecture. In 2004, she founded her solo practice, OOAA (Office of Architectural Affairs).

This is one of our weekly sessions. Beginners' hour starts at 7:00 with instruction on basic footwork and formations, allowing everyone to participate in some fun social dances. From about 8:00 until 9:15, we have a Social Class - the focus is on more experienced dancers and complex dances, but beginners are encouraged to stay and watch, and participate in some of the simpler dances.


Beginners are always welcome, no partner necessary. (In fact, you will be encouraged to dance with more experienced dancers rather than with other beginners.)

The $7.00 fee per person for each class covers the cost of renting the room and paying the teacher. First-time attendees and dues-paying members pay only $5. We do not want price to be an obstacle for anyone attending class. Beginners have the option of purchasing a coupon booklet (good for 10 classes) for $30. Full-time students can always pay only $3 to attend. If these options don't work for you, please let me or one of the teachers know and other arrangements can be made.

Please don't be discouraged by the lack of RSVPs - many of our members do not belong to Meetup and so do not RSVP here. There will definitely be a crowd of dancers present!

results.description:
If you're into music, and even if you're not, here's a great opportunity to share any music you're interested in, have a cup of coffee or tea, and engage in conversation. We'll meet at Coffee Tree Roasters in Shadyside to chat, drink coffee, and listen to music. Bring your favorite music on your phone or thumb drive to share -- you can even bring an instrument to play if you'd like. And you can just come for the coffee and company – you absolutely aren't required to bring music (I will bring my laptop to look things up on YouTube as well).

Bring any music -- if you have music of your own creation, if you're passionate about a particular musician or band, or if you just like something and feel like sharing. It could be a recent find or something that influenced your childhood and got you though your teenage years. It could be something you love or it could even be something you hate -- just tell us why. Music is as much a story as anything -- it could be a story of you, or the story of the artist who created the music, or the story could be embedded in the song itself waiting for us to listen. Feel free to bring a story to share along with the music -- or not, if you prefer.

We're totally open to any kind of music so, please, bring anything you'd like to share be it classical, ethnic, heavy metal, or whatever -- even classical ethnic heavy metal (I bet it exists). We'll be meeting at Coffee Tree Roasters from 7pm (to probably 9pm though the room's booked until 10pm).

This event is also posted on meetin.org.

results.description:
Get Heard! Get Noticed! Get Leads! (TM)

Hosted by: Susan Miller - WSBA Founder and Serial Entrepreneur 

This is an informal networking event, open to any business woman who would like to increase her business contacts or clients in the Cranberry/Wexford area.

Things to bring:

- 10-20 business cards or marketing material

- cash for your lunch check

- $5 meeting fee (non members only)

AGENDA

1:00 pm - attendees arrive, reviews menu, gives the server their drink order, and open networking: everyone stands up to introduce oneself to others and pass their business card

1:15 pm - server takes lunch order and the sign in sheet is passed around

1:30 pm - 60 sec. commercials begin

2:00 pm - each person gives a testimony or referral for someone attending the lunch

2:30 pm - Premier member does a 5 min. company presentation

2:35 pm - WSBA announcements from Debi/Susan

2:45 pm - lunch has ended. Open networking is welcomed.

Be prepared to do a 60 second commercial and provide the following information.

- Your goal for attending or
- What is a good referral for you or
- Name one product or service they offer that will specifically help small business owners or business professionals.

Please RSVP if you plan to attend this lunch. If your schedule becomes free the day of the lunch, then you may attend without an RSVP. This lunch is subject to cancellation when the lunch has 3 or less RSVPs. Lunch cancellation policy.

If you are not a WSBA member and would like to attend as a guest, please contact <a>Kimfitnesschic</a> at [masked] 

If you have an interest in becoming a General member ($50/year) or Premier member ($100/year) of WSBA, please contact <a>Debi Arnett</a> at [masked]

Any non member is subject to removal from this if they RSVP for an event and they do not attend.

We can eat while I'm going through the basics, so feel free to grab some food when you arrive at Panera.

Let me know if you have any questions... you can easily contact me through the meetup group.

results.description:
Join us on Tuesdays for American Mah Jong! Folks begin arriving around 5PM, and play begins table by table as soon as we have three or four players plus a set.  (We usually have 3-5 tables.)  By 6:15 or so, most players have arrived. We rotate among the tables... at the end of each game, East walks around to see if another table is close to the end of their game, so that two players can swap places.   At the other end of the evening... play must end by 9PM when Panera closes.  Tables begin wrapping up play any time after 8:15 or so.


If you have never played, or if you have not played for a very long time, we highly recommend that you take a Mah Jong 101 beginner class before playing with us - beginner classes are offered every few months.  Mah jong is a wonderful game, but it's hard to learn by just watching others play!


Please order your 2015 card from the National Mah Jongg League, here: http://www.nationalmahjonggleague.org/ Amazon.com also carries the cards. Note that you want the NMJL card, and no other! (There are some colorful alternatives out there.. but we play NMJL card and rules.)

Experienced players -- please bring your cards and please bring a set if you have one.

Please do not bring any outside food or beverages into Panera! Instead, please plan to buy *something* from Panera, even if it's just a beverage or a cookie, to support their willingness to host us.

results.description:
http://img2.meetupstatic.com/img/1723755200050492932723/smileys/biggrin.gifBeginner ukulele players in the South Hills of Pittsburgh. Now  you can jam with other newer players at Mt. Lebanon Library the 2nd and 4th Tuesday of each month.

These sessions are for players who have had a few lessons or know some basic chords and want to learn more while playing with others. We will experiment with basic strums, alternate chords and how to move from one chord to the next. We will play songs slowly at first and then again, only faster.

The group will choose the songs they want to play using "The Daily Ukulele 365 Songs for Better Living," by Liz and Jim Beloff. This book is available from local music stores and online.

Bring your ukulele and a floor music stand along with the music book. If you want to play songs other than what is in this book, please notify the group the week prior so copies can be made.

As we progress, we will open the group to more advanced players and more challenging music selections.

If you have any questions, please contact Patty Williams at [masked].
results.name: Beginner Ukulele Jam - 4th Tuesday
